She has successfully repaid two prior loans of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, which she used to buy ingredients to make products to sell. She is applying for a new loan of 11,000 PHP to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City, and reaches out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand her small business

location.town: Bugo, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ernesto Genez

texts.es:
El Sr. Ernesto es constructor de viviendas y quinchos, también realiza trabajos de jardinería, es oriundo de la compañía de Tañarandy de la ciudad de San Ignacio Misiones.

Don Ernesto es soltero, es independiente de sus padres y vive en casa propia con su familia.
El cliente siente gran satisfacción por operar con la institución y agradece la oportunidad.-
texts.en:
Ernesto builds homes and covered patios, and also works as a gardener. He is a native of the small town of Tañarandy, which is just outside the city of San Ignacio Misiones. Ernesto is single, independent of his parents, and lives in his own home with his family. He is very pleased to work with this institution, and appreciates the opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: various - to buy an electric mower

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is a 37-year-old entrepreneur from the province of Agusan del Sur. She manages a rice farm and a rice mill. She has two children with her husband, Melanio. In her spare time, she also does some food processing, which she started by using income from her rice farm. She does all this to provide for her family's needs, especially her children's education.

Ma. Theresa is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP. This is her first time to ask for a loan, and she will use it to fund her farm. She said she will buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Lennie

texts.en:
Lennie R., 44, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. Married to Geraldo R., a tricycle driver, she is blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been a tricycle operator for quite some time now.
Lennie has been a regular member of Kiva partner, Center for Community Transformation (CCT), for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she is now able to borrow quite a few times more from CCT’s cooperative. Lennie is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her tricycle business.
Now, with your help, she would like to apply for a loan of 10,000 PHP. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying new tires and paying for a tune-up for the tricycle. Lennie dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy new tires and pay for a tune-up for the tricycle

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua M. sells salted fish, such as salted tilapia and salted octopus, in Jukwa. She carries her wares on her head as she moves from place in search of customers. Though this form of selling is very tedious, she says it works for her. 

Ekua has no educational background and has been selling salted fish for some time now. As a widow, she singlehandedly provides food, clothing, and shelter for herself and children. Her loan will be added to her original income in order to buy more salted fish to sell, as well as to buy fresh fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to put some of the new profits from her business into savings in order to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more salted fish to sell and to buy fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Kadzo Katana

texts.en:
Kadzo is 23 years old and married to Changawa, a taxi driver. Together they have four children whose ages are between 10 years old and 3 years old. Kadzo is in the business of selling vegetables and fruit in the Kibokoni area of Malindi, where her targets customers are the locals. She has been in business for the past two years, and she earns a monthly profit of Kshs 6,500. 

Kadzo was introduced to Kadet by an existing client and this is her first loan. With this loan, she will renovate the food stand with Kshs 3,000, restock vegetables and fruit with Kshs 3,000, and diversify to another business of selling clothes with Kshs 5,000. She hopes to earn a profit to use as savings, and invest more in her children’s education.

Kadzo is a hardworking woman, and in the future, she hopes to own a Nissan matatu, which she will use in the transport business, thus boosting her income.

loans.use: Renovate food stand, stock vegetables and fruit, and open up another business of selling clothes

loans.name: Gotitas De Cristal Group

texts.es:
La sra. Micaela S. V. es presidenta de un grupo de 12 personas, cada una de ellas con una actividad diferente.
Se juntaron  por afinidad con la finalidad de reunir un grupo para solicitar un crédito a FUNDACION REALIDAD AC. El grupo se llama GOTITAS DE CRISTAL, por que menciona la presidenta que entre ella todo es transparente, todas se conocen entre si por varios años.
Algunas señoras ya han estado trabajando  con otras micro financieras  pero esta vez decidieron experimentar con esta, ya que les llama mucho la atención la bonificación por puntualidad  y el interés que es muy bajo.

La señora  Micaela es originaria de San marcos  un municipio que se ubica en la costa  chica del estado de Guerrero, Mexico.

Los habitantes de San Marcos se dedican principalmente a actividades agropecuarias y al comercio.
La sra. Micaela cuenta con 40 años de edad, esta casada  y cuenta con 2 hijos  de sexo masculino. Los dos en edad de primaria y secundaria, ella se dedica al comercio de ropa y regalos para cualquier tipo de ocasión.
Negocio con el cual tiene mas de 5 años, el crédito lo quiere para ampliar mas su negocio en mercancías.

Otra integrante del Grupo  es la sra. Filiberta B. E., lo cual cuenta con 44 años  de edad, ella se dedica al comercio de venta de ropa y plantas de ornato en los pueblos, su puesto es ambulante. Ella cuenta con 5 hijos de los cuales son 2 hombres y 3 mujeres, todos en edad escolar de primaria, secundaria y bachillerato, El crédito lo quiere para surtir sus negocios de mercancías  para incrementar más sus ventas. La señora Filiberta opina que le gustaría seguir trabajando con los cerditos  de fundación para seguir incrementando sus negocios.

INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO Y SU ACTIVIDAD

MARIANA L. C., VENTA DE ROPA. 
MICAELA S. V., VENTA DE PERFUMES Y ROPA.
FILIBERTA B. E., VENTA DE PLANTA DE HORNATO.
FELICIANA A. R., VENTA DE PAN.
MA DEL SOCORRO C. R., VENTA DE ORO. 
ROGELIA L. C., VENTA DE ABARROTES.
RODOLFINA L. C., VENTA DE QUESOS.
CELSA M. T., VENTA DE ABARROTES.
TERESA V. S.,VENTA DE COMIDA.
JUANA S. C.,VENTA DE QUESOS.
MARIA DELIA H. Q.,SERVICIO DE PELUQUERIA.
texts.en:
Micaela S. V. is the president of a group of 12 people. Each one of them has a different activity. They joined together in order to ask for a loan from Fundación Realidad AC. The name of the group is Gotitas de Cristal (Drops of Crystal). The president says that is the name because everything between them is transparent. They have known each other well for several years. Some of the women have already worked with other small loans, but this time they decided to try this. The bonus for punctuality really catches their attention, and the interest is very low. Micaela is a native and resident of San Marcos, which is a municipality located in Costa Chica in the State of Guerrero, Mexico. The inhabitants of San Marcos mainly work in agriculture and commerce. Micaela, age 40, is married and has two sons. One is in elementary school, and the other goes to high school. She sells clothes and gifts for all occasions. She has had the business for over five years. She wants the loan to increase the merchandise in her business. Filiberta B. E. is another member of the group. She is 44 years old, and she sells clothes and decorative plants in the villages. She sells door-to-door. She has five children, two boys and three girls. They are all school age and attend elementary school, middle school, or high school. She wants the loan to stock her business with merchandise in order to increase her sales. Filiberta says that she would like to keep working with loans from the Fundación in order to keep increasing her business. Members of the group and their activities: Mariana L. C.: Sells Clothes Micaela S. V.: Sells Perfume and Clothes Filiberta B. Esanislao: Sells Decorative Plants Feliciana A. R.: Sells Bread Maria del Socorro C. R.: Sells Gold Rogelio L. C.: Sells Groceries Rodolfina L. C.: Sells Cheese Celsa M. T.: Sells Groceries Teresa V. S.: Sells Food Juana S. C.: Sells Cheese Maria Delia H. Q.: Hairdresser

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the small business of selling perfume

location.town: Localidad de San Marcos, Municipio de San Marcos,

loans.name: Mario Roberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Mario P. es cliente recurrente, es casado y vive en casa propia. 
El titular trabaja en forma independiente hace mas de 15 años realizando trabajos en piedras de mármol para clientes particulares y arquitectos sobre pedidos. 
A la fecha el titular ha retirado dicho préstamo para la compra de un lote de piedras en bruto ya que cuenta con un pedido importante.
texts.en:
Sr. Mario P. is a returning client. He is married and lives in his own home.

Mario has worked independently for more than 15 years creating compositions made of marble for private clients and architects upon request. At the moment, he is applying for a loan to purchase a load of unpolished stones so that he can complete an important request.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase unpolished marble stones

loans.name: Febe

texts.en:
Febe P., 40, is making sure that her family has enough to provide for their daily needs. She is a single mother with two children. She makes sure that she earns well so that her family can have a better life. She has been managing her own food stall business while also selling ready-to-wear items and silver jewelry for quite some time now.

Febe has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she has used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 50,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying more ready-to-wear items, silver jewelry and raw ingredients needed to continue production of her food stall business.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education. She also dreams of being able to put up her own commercial space.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for her food stall business, some ready-to-wear items and various designs of silver jewelry.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia Q. is from the village of Sto. Nino Manolo, Fortich Bukidnon. She is 51 years old. Lydia is married and has 3 school-aged children. Lydia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells food & daily use products. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lydia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lydia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Felix, tiene 70 años, vive con su esposa e hijos, el se dedica al servicio de transporte desde hace 10 años aproximadamente, realiza el servicio de taxi en la ciudad de ica y anteriormente realizaba el servicio de colectivo a marcona, dandole a sus clientes la seguridad de un buen servicio, Felix solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas nuevas para su automovil y también para la renovación del soat entre otros arreglos que desea hacerle a su auto, se le brinda el crédito por su capacidad de pagos y por buenas referencias personales.
texts.en:
Felix is 70 years old, and lives with his wife and children. He has dedicated himself to providing transportation services for approximately the past 10 years. He provides taxi services in the city of Ica, and previously provided a colectivo (shared taxi) service to Marcona. He always provides safe transport and an excellent level of service. Felix is requesting a loan in order to buy new tires for his automobile, to renew his SOAT (obligatory auto insurance), and to make other repairs. He is being extended credit due to his ability to make the payments, and because of good personal references.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To renew his auto insurance (SOAT).

loans.name: Julies Margot

texts.es:
Julies de 49 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciales informales), ella confecciona ropa y reparte en algunos locales. 

Hace 10 años comenzó a trabajar cuando se divorcio de su esposo, comenzando con una maquina de coser vieja pudo tener suficientes clientes para solventar sus gastos. Trabaja todos los días en su casa confeccionando pantalones, vestidos, blusas a sus clientes y así tener ingresos suficientes para darles una mejor vida a su hijo de 17 años. 

Para continuar con su taller de confección de ropa ella quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa y maquina de coser, en el futuro quiere trabajar con empleados y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Julies, 49, lives in Guayaqui’s Guasmo area (an urban zone most of whose residents are informal merchants). She makes clothes that she distributes to several stores. She started working 10 years ago when she divorced her husband. She started with an old sewing machine and acquired enough customers to be able to meet her expenses. She works every day making pants, dresses and blouses for her customers in order to have enough income to provide a better life for her 17-year-old son. To continue with her clothing manufacturing shop she wants to use the loan to buy clothes and a sewing machine. In the future, she’d like to hire employees and finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For clothes and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Noel Agustin

texts.es: Noel Agustín tiene 35años, su actividad económica es la pesca artesanal.  Inicio este negocio por medio de su hermano, ya que le había prestado el dinero para que empezara su propio negocio tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. El nos cuenta que no es la prima vez que realiza financiamientos, por lo que han sido beneficiosos. Por lo que ha sido una persona muy responsable y se siente muy contento. Ahora solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de equipos de pesca, redes, líneas de pesca entre otras cosas. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Noel Agustín is 35 years old. He is a small-scale fisherman. He started this business by means of his brother who lent him the money to start his own business. Noel has two minor children under his care. He tells us that this is not the first time he has worked with loans, and they have been beneficial. He has been a very responsible person, and he is very content. He is now requesting this loan for working capital. He will buy fishing equipment, nets, and fishing lines, among other things. He dreams of improving his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Sarann Yin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has twenty-three members who live in Tuol Trea village, in TaK. province.  Sarann Y. is the bank's president, selected by the members.  Each member will use their portion of the loan to support their families. 

Sarann is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice that she sells to support her family.  She is also a pig breeder.  Her husband is a village chief and construction worker. 

Since her pig breeding business is going well, she wants to expand.  Sarann is seeking a loan to buy more piglets, pig food, and to hire farm laborers to grow rice. 

Sarann is a mother of four children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory and the others go to school and help their parents..

loans.use: Buy piglets, pig food and more.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 28-year-old married woman and mother of 3 young children who still attend school. In 2009, she has decided to open a mini-market in her town. Her new business is essential to help her husband with the heavy expenses. She offers variety of products to her clients such as dairy products, food products, and detergents as per their needs. Today, she is requesting to borrow $500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her store’s inventory before the coming holidays. 

It is very common in Lebanon to find small supermarkets, selling perishable and non-perishable goods. As members of the communities themselves, store owners have a deep understanding of local consumer needs and can offer products that meet local demands. The strong network of community relationships are an important component of life in Lebanon, especially in smaller towns and villages.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong S., 38, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. sells food and dessert for an income of about USD 8 per day. Her husband is a supervisor at a Korean school, earning an income of about USD 2 per day. 

The family has to spend USD 120 on food and USD 15 on electricity supply every month. S. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase beverages to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph because S. was not available.

loans.use: To buy more beverages to resell.

loans.name: Diondra

texts.en:
After styling hair for six years, Diondra Y. decided to fulfill her dream of starting her own business: Pinkie’s Exotic Stylz, LLC. She plans to use her loan to equip her salon with everything a salon requires: chairs, products, massage table, waiting room furniture, etc. To prepare for this transition, Diondra took several business management classes and attended conferences on all the latest hair treatment methods. Her business offers infusions, relaxes, color treatments, hair replacements for cancer patients, weaving, microlinks and more. 

Diondra is a go-getter, to say the least. Not only is Diondra a single mother of two daughters, she is working closely with non-profit organizations on offering her services to homeless women to help them look presentable for job interviews.

loans.use: To buy salon furniture and products

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty K. is currently in the business of selling cold drinks and snacks such as soda and ice cream, and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of soda to sell. Betty is 25 years old and married. Her husband is a logistic officer. She has five children, who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: To stock more crates of soda to sell

loans.name: Bukasa Developement Group-Mukono

texts.en:
Edward S. is 52 years old and belongs to the Bukasa Development Group in Mukono. He is a father to four and for the last four years he has been running a bricklaying and sand-mining business in Bukasa, Mukono. Edward earns 600,000 shillings a month. He also gets some additional money as a farm manager. He says he is going to use this loan to pay his laborers.

Edward's future plan is to buy land for his family and also increase the production of bricks.

loans.use: To pay his workers' wages.

loans.name: Myagmarhajid

texts.en:
Myagmarhajid Y. is 43 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family sold their house and fence and purchased their own apartment, where they live,  with a leasing loan. 

Both her two children attend university and her husband is a driver in the factory. 

Myagmarhajid operates a women's lingerie retail business from a stall at the main market in Narantuul. She sells a variety of different women's underwear and lingerie and her wide product selection attracts many customers. She started her business in 2000 and since has built a stable operation. After many years of running this business, she has gained a lot of experience as a trader. Today, her working capital exceeds 1500000 MNT. 

Both of her siblings also operate women's underwear-selling businesses out of different stalls. She is a clever, honest and open-minded person. She is requesting a 1000000 MNT loan to import more women's underwear and lingerie from Erlian, a border city of China.

loans.use: To import more women's underwear and lingerie

loans.name: Synem

texts.en:
Mrs. Synem H. (pictured with her loom) is 36 years old and her husband, Mr. Bora Yun, is 41 years old.  They live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  They have been married since 2000 and have three sons.  Two attend school and another one is still young.  

Synem has been weaving since 1990.  She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell at market in Phnom Penh.  Her husband has full-time employment in Phnom Penh.  She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase materials for her weaving business and buy rice for food.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her weaving business and buy rice for food.

loans.name: Gloria Argentina

texts.es:
la señora Gloria Argentina M. esta casada y no tiene dependientes, todos sus hijos son personas mayores.
Gloria se dedica a la venta de abarroteria como ser pastas, arroz, azucar, jabon, queso, harina, aceite, maiz, y todo lo relacionado con productos de consumo diario.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de algunos productos que necesita para surtir mas su pulperia.
 sus clientes son personas de la localidad y lugares aledaños.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos personales y los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Gloria Argentina M. is married and has no dependents.  All of her children are already grown up.

Gloria sells groceries such as pasta, rice, sugar, soap, cheese, flour, oil, corn and other daily-use products.

She will use her loan to buy some products that she needs to better stock her small grocery store.  Her customers are people from her own town and neighboring places.  She needs the profits she makes from her store to cover her personal expenses and her household expenses.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, butter, oil, margarine, soap, batteries, toilet paper, candles, matches, toothpaste, sanitary towels, soup, pasta, sauces, soft drinks and juices

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert W. is 25 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. Robert has a butcher's business, which he has run for five years.
To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more meat. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Robert hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Robert hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Virginia De Jesus

texts.es:
doña Virginia de Jesus A. tiene 59 años de edad, vive en el Barrio el Centro del Triunfo Choluteca y se dedica a su negocio que es una chiclera,  tiene la ayuda economica de su esposo para cubrir con los gastos el hogar, juntos trabajan duro para sacar adelante su hogar. Virginia es madre de 4 hijos, adultos  y ya no dependen de ella economicamente.
en sus sus tiempos libres lo dedican a visitar la iglesia y visitar la familia.
el credito lo utilizaran para comprar mercaderia y asi surtir su chiclera. 
nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que a logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos y que sus metas poco a poco se le han estado cumpliendo.
texts.en: Ms. Virginia de Jesus A. is 59 years old, lives in the neighborhood of Centro del Triunfo Cholucteca and works in her own business as a snack vender.  She has the help of her husband to cover the household expenses. Together they are working hard to get ahead for their home and family. Virginia is the mother of 4 adult children who no longer depend on her financially. In her free time she visits church and family. The loan will be used to buy merchandise and to stock her snackbar. She commented to us that she feels very happy that she is succeeding already in getting ahead for her children and that little by little she has been accomplishing her goals.

loans.use: to buy churros, candies, cookies, juices, soft drinks, bonbons and gum.

loans.name: Ange Obed

texts.es:
Angel  de 32 años de edad,  tiene 1 hijo menor de edad  estudiandia su primaria quien esta al cuidado de la abuelita; Don Angel labora para el Residencial Bosques de Juigalpan desde hace un año como Guarda de seguridad,  ha demostrado ser una persona responsable, desempeñando su trabajo con eficiencia y dedicacion, ha superado los obstaculos de la vida con sacrificio de modo que se esmera para que a su familia no le falte el pan de cada dia.  

Necesita este financiamiento con el apoyo de Kiva para reparar el techo y asi brindarle mayor seguridad a su familia y  mejores condiciones de vida. 

Su sueño es darle una excelente educacion a su hijo y tener un trabajo digno para darle lo mejor a su Familia.
texts.en:
Angel, age 32, has one young child in elementary school who is cared for by his grandmother. Angel has worked for the Residencial Bosques de Juigalpan [company] for one year as a security guard. He has proven himself to be a responsible person who does his work with efficiency and dedication. He has overcome the obstacles of life with sacrifice, and he has worked very hard so that his family does not lack their daily bread.

He needs this loan, with Kiva's support, to repair the roof of his home in order to offer his family greater security and better living conditions.

His dream is to give his child an excellent education, and to have decent work so that he can give his family the best.

loans.use: Repairing the roof of his house

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Georgina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene dos hijos, realizo estudios de educación superior. 
La señora es una socia nueva, recientemente se incorpora como socia del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo solicitado fue de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá para implementar su tienda de abarrotes, comprará arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceites, etc.  También nos cuenta que trabaja en la chacra junto con su esposo quien es trabajador en  el municipio de Ilave.
Su sueño es llenar la tienda con diversos productos y tener una buena casa propia.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad de pago.
texts.en:
Georgina is a member of the “Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” community bank which is located in Ilave district, in El Collao province, in Puno department.  She is 37 years old, married, and has two children.  She has a high school education.

This lady is a new member who has recently joined Movimiento Manuela Ramos.  Her first loan is for 1,000 Peruvian soles and she will invest the money in setting up her grocery store.  She will buy rice, sugar, noodles, oils, etc.  She also tells us that she works on the farm together with her husband who works for the town of Ilave.

Georgina's dream is to fill her store with a variety of products and to own a good home.  What she likes about her community bank is the ease of making loan repayments.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, noodles, oils, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and her newborn baby. She started her business as a beautician from her home. She has been involved in this occupation since 2004. Her business is essential because with its income, she is able to help her husband pay the household expenses. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to invest in expanding her inventory selection. She has high hopes for the future of her business; she is looking to continue expansion of her business in the coming year and open a formal beauty salon.

loans.use: invest in expanding her inventory selection

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia tiene 32 años y nació en el departamento Cusco provincia de Urubamba. Actualmente, Emilia vive en la ciudad de donde nació, ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tienen cuatro, ella es una madre luchadora, trabajadora  que a pesar de las adversidad saca adelante a su familia, ella nos cuenta que tiene un puesto de venta abarrotes en  el mercado de Urubamba, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el micro crédito para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más.

Emilia pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Marcela de Virgen del Carmen” de la Asociación Arariwa  y trabaja con sus compañeras del banco comunal desde hace varias años.
texts.en:
Emilia is 32 years old, and she was born in Urubamba, a department of the province of Cusco. Emilia currently lives in the city where she was born; she is married with four children. In spite of the adversity her family has faced, she is a strong and hard-working mother. She tells us that she has a grocery stall in the Urubamba market, and she hopes to use micro credit to be able to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, pasta, and other things.

Emilia belongs to the "Villa Marcela de Virgen del Carmen" community bank, part of the Arariwa Association, and has worked with her co-members from the community bank for several years.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, pasta, and other items.

loans.name: Ibrahim Kalil

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ibrahim Kalil Sidibé est âgée de 33  ans, marié et  père de 2 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants au  quartier Médine de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école   pour des raisons sociales, il commença très tôt à faire le commerce de parures auprès  de sa grande sœur qui 
menait des activités commerciales au marché de Médine. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à son côté, il commence à évoluer seul pour faire le commerce d’articles divers et cela depuis 10 ans  et  jouit d’une grande expérience dans ce domaine. 
Dans le souci de toujours mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse, il sollicite ce deuxième prêt, le premier ayant été correctement remboursé. Il est en relation avec  Soro Yiriwaso,  depuis 12 mois.  Il compte utiliser ce deuxième prêt pour acheter, 10 complets de chaînes et 2 douzaines de tasses inoxydables. Il  s’approvisionne sur place.
Monsieur Ibrahim Kalil Sidibé vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes parmi ses clients figurent quelques hommes.
Ainsi avec ce prêt il envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA, ce qui lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et de continuer son activité.  
Son ambition est de pérenniser son activité et d’avoir plus de financement.
texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahim Kalil Sidibé is 33 years old, married and father to two children. He lives with his wife and children in the Medine district of the town of Ségou (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region).

Since he did not attend school, for social reasons, he began selling sets of jewelry with his elder sister who carried out her trading activities at the market in Médine. After several years' apprenticeship with her, he began to develop his own business selling various items and has been doing this now for ten years, thus benefiting from significant experience in this field. 

With the intention of satisfying his ever growing customer base even more, he is requesting this second loan, the first having been repaid in full. He has been working with Soro Yiriwaso for the past twelve months. He is planning to use this second loan to buy ten chain sets and two dozen stainless steel cups. He gets his supplies locally.

Mr. Sidibé sells for cash and on credit to a customer base made up principally of women although he does have some male customers. 

With this loan he is expecting to make a monthly profit of 100,000FCFA, which will allow him to repay his loan and to continue his business. His ambition is to maintain his business in the long term and to be able to access more funding.

loans.use: to purchase various items

loans.name: Zereg

texts.en:
Zereg is 23 years old and lives with his wife and two children in their own house in Hovd province, Mongolia. His wife is unemployed an takes care of their children. He manages a public transportation service business between two provinces. He started his business in 2008 with the help of his older brother. Since then his business has been quite successful and allowed him to conduct his business independently. 

Besides his transportation business he manages a vegetable planting business in order to contribute to his family earnings. He is planning to buy a car for his wife which can be used in a taxi service business. He is a polite man who attributes his business success to his good accounting skills. He says, "I want to have an apartment in the future." He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT of loan to purchase a car.

loans.use: To purchase a car which can be used as a taxi.

loans.name: Chroeung

texts.en: Chroeung K. is a 40-year-old married woman who resides in the province of Kompong Cham. Chroeung K. is blessed with four school-aged children. She earns a living by planting various crops on her own farmland. She now plants a potato crop, which she will harvest and collect when they are mature. She always brings her items to sell in the local market. The size of her land is very small and she wishes to enlarge it in order to build a new house on it. Because of insufficient money, Chroeung K. is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a plot of land that she will use to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land to build a new house.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: Marcos Antonio tiene 2  hijos menores de edad, él es un hombre muy responsable de 57 años que ha sostenido su hogar trabajando independientemente. Su  negocio que inició hace cuarenta años ya que anteriormente él trabajaba en una radio  luego decidió establecer su propio negocio de servicios musicales. Su meta a nivel familiar es que algún día sus hijos sean profesionales y su meta empresarial es aumentar su inventario con herramientas necesarias. Su crédito es para  comprar computadoras, controles, alambres, micrófonos entre otras herramientas que se solicitan.
texts.en: Marcos Antonio has 2 minor children.  He is a responsible 57 year-old man who has supported his household through his independent work.  He started his music services business 40 years ago after working for a radio station.  His goal for his family is to someday see his children become professionals, and his goal for his business is to have more equipment to use in his work.  This loan will be used to buy computers, controllers, wires, microphones and other equipment that he needs.

loans.use: to buy computers, controllers, wires and microphones

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa, tiene casa propia, vive con su familia y su hijo D. 3 años D. edad, tiene un negocio D. productos D. primera necesidad, lo inicio hace 3 años y ofrece a los clientes artículos no perecederos y granos básicos.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para adquirir mercadería: aceite, azúcar, embutidos, gaseosas, papel higiénico, jabón, esta inversión le ayudara para crecer en su inventario y estar preparada para atender la demanda.
Su objetivo con el negocio, es mantenerlo surtido D. toda mercadería, dar un buen servicio a la clientela y mejorar las condiciones D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa has her own house and lives with her ​​family and her 3-year-old son.  She has a business selling basic supplies that she started 3 years ago and offers customers non-perishable items and basic grains.  

She is currently seeking a loan to buy merchandise such as oil, sugar, sausages, soft drinks, toilet paper, and soap.  This investment will help to grow her inventory and help her be prepared to meet demand.

Her business objective is to keep an assortment of merchandise, proviD. good service to customers and improve the lives of her family.

loans.use: To buy oil, sugar, sausages, soft drinks, toilet paper, and soap.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 59 years old and married. She has three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rosemarie has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years.

Rosemarie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money to support and expand the business for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Porvenir Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado porvenir se encuentra compuesto por 12 mujeres de la ciudad de Asunción. El mismo se encuentra en su primer ciclo. Al hablar con ellas se definieron como mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, que tienen sueños que quieren cumplir. Justamente por ello se organizaron y se formaron para la consecución de sus anhelos.
La Sra. Librada tiene 21 años, tiene dos hijos menores de edad escolar, y se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo. Comenta que por sus hijos ella se sacrifica todos los días para asegurarles una vida digna y decorosa. Sueña con algún día poder armarse con un pequeño puesto donde pueda ofrecer sus mercaderías sin dejar a sus hijos.
Solicita el credito para poder comprar mas ropas que luego venderá, posee un pequeño grupo, pero le gustaría comprar las ropas de esta temporada de invierno. Tiene sus esperanzas puestas en el credito.
texts.en: The "Porvenir" group consists of 12 women from the city of Asunción, Paraguay, and is on its first loan cycle. The members defined themselves as hard-working women who fight for their dreams to come true. They organized and formed this group for this very reason, so they could reach their goals. One of the members is Librada. She is 21 years old, has two children under school age, and makes a living selling all kinds of clothing. She says that she sacrifices all of her days for her children to assure them a dignified and decent life. She dreams that one day she can have a small sales post where she can offer her merchandise without leaving her children behind. She is requesting the loan to be able to purchase more clothing to then sell. She has a small supply, but she would like to buy clothing during the current winter season. Her hopes rest with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase all kinds of clothing to later sell.

loans.name: Reintegracion Group

texts.es:
El grupo Reintegración lo conforman cuatro mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora es la señora María Elena de 42 años comerciante de ropa y zapatos desde hace 7 años el cual inicio con unos ahorros y luego lo fue aumentando. El sueño de ella es llegar a tener una tienda en su casa. 
Las otras integrantes son Deysi María tiene una tienda de ropa usada desde hace 2 años, Ingrid de 40 años se dedica al comercio de verduras desde hace 3 años, y Concepción ella es costurera y vende materiales de costura (telas, hilos, aguja, cintas, aplicaciones, bordados…etc.
texts.en:
The Reintegracion group is made up of four hard-working and enterprising women. The coordinator is Mrs. Maria Elena, age 42, who has sold clothing and shoes for 7 years. She started this business with her savings and it has been growing. Her dream is to have a store in her home. 
The other members are Deysi Maria, who has had a used clothing store for 2 years; Ingrid, age 40, who has sold vegetables for 3 years; and Concepcion, who is a seamstress and sells sewing materials (fabric, thread, needles, ribbon, applications, embroidering, etc).

loans.use: to purchase merchandise; clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Majelis Taqlim Group

texts.en:
Masyatie is 54 years old and has three children. She opened a grocery store in 2001. She borrowed 2,000,000 Indonesian Rupiah from VisionFund Indonesia to buy daily need items like eggs, rice, flour, cooking oil, etc. 

Up to now, with her grocery store, she has been able to send her children to school. She hopes she can expand her grocery store and continue to send her children to school through the university level.

loans.use: to stock daily needs like eggs, cooking oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Daisy

texts.en:
Ma. Daisy is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Ma. Daisy has a retail shop that sells fruits & vegetables like bananas & watermelons. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy bananas & vegetables to sell.

Ma. Daisy is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ma. Daisy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas & vegetables to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a single mother of one girl who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, electricity, clothing and school fees. 

For the past seven years, she has operated a motor vehicle transport business. She has also operated a video café business which provides her with another source of income. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. With her KES 20,000 loan she wants to purchase spare parts to service her motor vehicle. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to service her motor vehicle.

loans.name: Ada Elsy

texts.es: Ada Elsy de treinta años de edad vive con sus dos hijos menores. Ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, la cual le ayuda a sostener los gastos de su hogar, su tienda es la más surtida del lugar, los clientes siempre encuentran lo que necesitan, con productos de muy buena calidad y a precios realmente accesibles; Ada Elsy es una mujer con un carisma increíble, siempre esta alegre y se lo transmite a cada persona que visita la tienda;  quiere ver crecer su negocio y para ella no hay un imposible que la deje abandonar su sueño, es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, bebidas, productos instantáneos, aceite, embutidos, jabones entre otros. Ada Elsy tiene fe que con su trabajo logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ada Elsy, aged 30, lives with her two young children.  She has a store where she sells everyday items, which helps her to cover her household expenses. Her store is the best stocked in the neighborhood; her customers always find what they need, and she offers very good quality products at affordable prices.

Ada Elsy is a woman with incredible charisma; she is always happy and this comes across to every person who visits her store.  She wants to see her business grow, and there is nothing that will make her abandon her dream.  This is why she decided to to request a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy bulk grains, candy, drinks, instant foods, oil, sausages, and soap among other things.

Ada Elsy has faith that with her work, she will be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, candy, drinks, instant foods, oil, sausages, and soap.

loans.name: Battogtoh

texts.en:
Battogtoh is a 31-year-old who lives with his two brothers in a house which he built in his own hands in the Hentii province of Mongolia. Battogtoh operates a taxi service business. He has been doing this service since 2005. He started his business by driving a Hyundai Excel and now that business has expanded, he is driving a Hyundai Accent. 

Due to his many years of service, he has many regular customers. By doing the business, he feeds his family members. He is a diligent man who says, "I love what I do; it feels good to serve others and soon I will be buying a new car." He is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to buy a motor for his car and to repair his house.

loans.use: To buy a motor and to repair his house.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: El señor Juan José es un hombre muy trabajador que desde hace 4 años adquirió su vivienda de interés social. En este momento se ven en la necesidad de cambiar la tubería de su casa por que cuando fue construido el material era de muy baja calidad; por lo que ahora ya comienza a tener problemas, a Juan José le preocupa esta situación por que le genera mayores gastos. Para que su proyecto sea realizado necesita comprar tubería, accesorios, pintura y pagar al plomero que le hará el trabajo.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan José is a hardworking gentleman who acquired his home four years ago through a government subsidy program. At the moment, he needs to replace the plumbing in his house because the original material that was used was of very poor quality. Now he is starting to have problems.

Juan José is concerned that this situation will lead to more expenses. For this project, he needs to buy pipes, fittings, paint, as well as pay a plumber to do the work.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor in order to replace the plumbing in his house.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a fifty-year-old married man with nine children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the produce business for ten years. He started by farming coffee and cotton and after accumulating enough savings, he diversified into cabbage-selling and the business has been very profitable. His hardship is insufficient capital to meet the increasing demand of his customers and his vision is a big food stall plus educating his children. Emmanuel wants money to buy cabbages to sell.

loans.use: to buy cabbages for sale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 33-year-old young man.  He is married and has five sons and three daughters.  He is a taxi driver.  This taxi business is the only source of income for his family.  

Mohammad wants to purchase a new engine for the taxi he owns and drives in order to increase the taxi's efficiency, but the amount of money he has isn't enough, so he needs to take a loan in the amount of $1,500 from FATEN.  When Mohammad gets the loan, he will be able to purchase a new engine for his taxi. This will enable him to work extra hours and increase his income and enable him to provide better living conditions to his family. 

Mohammad is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: buy a new engine for his taxi

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 40 years old, married and has has four children, all of whom attend school. 

She sells vegetables, like tomatoes and onions in South Sudan.  Betty has been in business for five years.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onion for resale.  She will use her extra income to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase onions for resale.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Julieta has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Julieta has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Julieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Maria Guadalupe cuenta con un negocio de Elaboración y Venta de tortillas, sus ventas las realiza de Lunes a Sábado,  tambien vende Elotes y Tamalitos.
el credito lo utilizara para invertirlo en la compra de tres fardos de ropa usada para vender en la epoca de navidad, Maria tiene su puesto de venta de tortillas en el mercado y desea probar vender ropa para tener mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
María Guadalupe has a business making and selling tortillas.  She sells from Monday through Saturday.  She also sells corn on the cob and tamales.

She will use the loan to invest in buying three bundles of used clothing to sell during the Christmas season.  María has her tortilla stall in the market and she wants to try selling clothes to have better profits.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Kadogo Group

texts.en:
Festus is the facilitator of the Kadogo group. Festus and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Festus takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season,Festus had a very good maize yield, harvesting 11 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Festus was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Festus and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Festus will educate his children, take care of loan repayment, and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Kadogo group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 53 years old and married with 8 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

She has borrowed and back paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Salvacion aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa, de 37 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Alejandro su esposo desde hace 18 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Atocc. En la zona alta de la ciudad de Pampas, se ubica la casa de Teresa. Donde todas las mañanas sale a cuidar de sus sembríos de papa, habas, alverja y demás productos oriundos de la zona. Además junto a su esposo cuidan de sus animales como cuyes, gallinas y cerdos. Los que vende cada vez que necesita dinero. Pues muchas veces le amparó de imprevistos que se presentaron en diversas ocasiones. Ahora desea mejorar su calidad de vida, mejorando su pequeña y cogedora vivienda. Sabe que lo logrará, pues en cada cosecha comercializa sus sembríos a la ciudad de Pampas, donde tiene buenos clientes, que le pagan mucho dinero por costal. Ella pertenece al banco comunal, sol naciente y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada; pues sus miembros son personas solidarias y muy trabajadoras. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Teresa de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Teresa, 37, is a hardworking woman. She lives with Alejandro, her husband of 18 years. They have 5 children they are raising in their own home, located in the neighborhood of Atocc, in the upper area of the city of Pampas.

Every morning Teresa leaves to tend to her fields of potatoes, fava beans, green peas and other products native to the area. In addition, she and her husband also care for their animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and pigs, which they sell whenever they need money, for often on different occasions they provide a source of support when the unexpected happens.

Now, Teresa wants to improve her quality of life by improving her small and welcoming home. She knows that she will succeed in doing so, since for each harvest of crops she sells in Pampas, where she has good customers, they pay her good money per bag. 

She belongs to the Sol Naciente Communal Bank and this is her first loan with MFP. She feels empowered in the bank, since the members are very hard working and supportive. In addition, she promises to make her payments punctually. Upon receiving your support, Teresa will invest the money in the purchase of natural fertilizers for her potato crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a stall to sell clothes from in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is 31 years old married woman, she lives in Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan.
Amal is looking to have a loan of 400JDs thus she can buy raw material for her amazing crafts.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her crafts

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angelica pertenece banco comunal “Fuente de Vida” y su actividad económica principal es la venta de ropa interior como medias, calzoncillos, polos, bivirís y otras cosas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone  en su trabajo.  En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como medias. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Angelica is a member of the community bank Fuente de Vida.  Her main work is selling clothing such as socks, boxers, shirts, men's briefs, and other items.  She has done this work for many years and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  

She will use this loan to purchase merchandise such as socks.  She is happy with this loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as socks.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas está en su 2do ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 1 de ellas tiene que seguir trabajando para mejorar, ya que esta con ingresos muy bajos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Antonia, quien realiza venta de comidas en lo que gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo está mejorando bastante, ella es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha por salir adelante e ir dando a su familia lo que necesitan.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, harina, huevo, carne y demás. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que ella y sus amigas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas [United Women] Group is in its second cycle in the Poverty Stoplight Program, where everyone is working to eliminate poverty.  One of its members must continue working in order to improve; her current income is quite low.

Antonia sells food that she makes.  Thanks to her work and determination, she is improving.  She is very hardworking and she fights to move herself forward so taht she can give her family everything they need.

She is asking for this loan to buy the ingredients she needs to continue making her food products, like vegetables, condiments, flour, eggs, meat, and other items.  She is thankful for the opportunity that she and her friends receive.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, flour, eggs, meat, and other items.

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en: Kong is 51 years old and a villager from in Battambang province. To secure a decent condition for her family, he does rice cropping as the main business. This business earns her about 35,000 KHR as income per day. This is not the first loan for Kong with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  He has repaid back his past loan with success and now his living condition is getting better than before.  Now, he teams up a group of four to get a new loan. As a leader group, he will spend this loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed for his crop. He hopes this loan will help him to make his income more than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for his crop

loans.name: Leila

texts.pt:
A senhora   Leila de 39 anos de idade é comerciante, mãe viúva de  4 filhos dos quais 2 estudam e 2 já maiores de idade sustenta um irmão que vive com ela.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar cervejas, refrescos, sumos, vinhos, e hortaliça para reforçar o seu negócio que e feito na sua banca e barraca na sua casa.
Seus sonhos e esperanças para o futuro são crescer no negócio, e ter um estabelecimento capaz de responder as necessidades de seus clientes.
Diz que a insuficiência de   fundos tem sido o maior desafio e para ultrapassa-lo faz poupancas e que irá solicitar mais créditos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en:
Ms Leila is 39 years old and trader, a widowed mother of 4 children - 2 of whom go to school and two who are already of age. She also supports a brother who lives with her.

She says that with this loan she will buy beers, sodas, juices, wine and vegetable to reinforce her business, where she sells these from a stall in her home.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to grow her business and have a commercial establishment from which she can respond to her customers' needs.

She says that her lack of funds has been her biggest challenge which she overcomes by saving money and that she will solicit further loans to carry out her plans.

loans.use: buy beers, sodas, juices, wine and vegetable to reinforce her business, where she sells these from a stall in her home

loans.name: Philisi's Group

texts.en:
Philis is 45 years old and has 6 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Philis has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Philis also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Philis's Group will be able to receive a total of 7 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine, a teacher with university degree, lives and works in Bnunis village of Shirak region. She has been working at the local village school for already 6 years. 
Karine's family consist of 5 members: her mother-in-law, husband and two little sons (in the photo). 
After her work as a teacher, Karine helps her husband with the family's farm. The family keeps a big livestock of 10 cows, 3 calves, 16 oxen, 20 sheep, and 2 piglets. Last year, with the profits gathered from farm, the family also purchased arable land near their house, where wheat and potato are cultivated. 
Karine's main goal is to sustain her family's living providing her children with normal living conditions. SHe requested this loan to purchase forage for feeding the livestock during the winter season. This is highly important for their farming business as the cattle is big and family can't purchase the forage for it with savings. Karine and her whole family hope to receive lenders' support and continue their hard and tireless work.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock during the winter season

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
This business is a member of the Revelations Women Group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff

Grace is a pastor of Regeneration church in Thika, Kenya. Through her church ministry, she has traveled to Uganda, Tanzania, Sudan and Rwanda. She has been a member of Revelation women group for the last 4 years. She is a mother of four.

In 2005 she received a loan of USD.300 and bought a cow. To date she has two dairy cows. She also practices horticulture farming on a small scale. She sells milk, onions, and cabbages to her neighbors and in Thika town.

loans.use: Grace wants to start up community phone services and a retail store near her church to bring services nearer to the people.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Ms. Pauline S. is a married mother of six children who also takes care of her mother, her younger brothers and two of her apprentices. She is a seamstress by trade. Her appreciation of a job well done has earned her the reputation of a respectable woman in her town. She has a lot of customers coming to her workshop, but the state of her machines does not allow her to fulfill all of their orders. Ms. Pauline S. is requesting a loan of $800 to buy new sewing machines and sell the cloth that her customers have requested. This will increase her income and help her to better take care of her family.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame S. Pauline est une femme mariée et mère de six (6) enfants et a à sa charge sa mère, ses petits frères et deux de ses apprentis. Elle est couturière de profession. Son sens de travail bien fait et bien appliqué fait d’elle une femme respectable dans sa localité. Son atelier est très fréquenté par des clients. Avec l’état de ses machines, elle n’arrive pas à honorer ses engagements vis-à-vis de cette clientèle exigeante. Madame S. Pauline sollicite un apport financier de $800 pour l’achat de nouvelles machines à coudre et sur la demande de sa clientèle vendre des tissus. Ceci augmentera son chiffre d’affaire et l’aidera à mieux s’occuper de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy two sewing machines and sell printed cloth

loans.name: Estani

texts.en:
Estani has paid off her first loan and is requesting a second loan to expand her growing business. Estani supports two daughters and a son thanks to the income of her clothing store, which she operates out of their home. She will also use this loan to purchase various household products that patrons of her clothing store are in the market for as well.

NOTE: Estani is one of four micro-entrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, which have all gone through Esperanza's business training courses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their shares of this $750 loan together. If a member is unable to pay in full on time, the group is responsible for making up the deficit before a payment can be made. Investors in this loan will receive an update on Estani's situation as well as that of the entire group.

loans.use: Invest in dresses, blouses and miscellaneous household items

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina is 21 years old and is single. Along with the rest of her family she makes tablecloths, napkins and patterned shawls. They currently sell them in the artisan market to people who have established businesses. She and Doña Rosa H. Lopez belong to the group ‘Montaña 4’. With the loan they hope to invest in more material and thread to make more and therefore sell more to the tourists in the area where they live.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Volunteer Translator

CATALINA TIENE 21 AÑOS , SOLTERA JUNTO CON SU FAMILIA TRABAJAN EN LA CONFECCION DE MANTELES , SERVILLETAS Y MANTAS ARTESANALES Y LAS BORDAN . POSTERIORMENTE LAS VENDEN EN EL MERCADO ARTESANAL A LAS PERSONAS QUE TIENEN NEGOCIOS ESTABLECIDOS . JUNTO CON DOÑA ROSA H. LOPEZ PERTENECEN AL GRUPO MONTAÑA 4.ESPERAN CON EL PRESTAMO INVERTIR EN COMPRAR MAS TELA E HILOS PARA ABASTECERSE DE MATERIA PRIMA Y AUMENTAR DE ESTA FORMA SUS CONFECCIONES Y ASI PODER VENDER ELLAS TAMBIEN EN SU LOCALIDAD A LOS TURISTAS DE LA ZONA .

loans.use: To sell crafts/VENTA DE ARTESANIAS

loans.name: Elmusa

texts.en: Elmusa M. is a 23-year-old businessman. He lives in the Azerbaijani southern Imishli region,  in Khishchibanli village. Elmusa just started his business in 2006, when he purchased a shed of sheep. He breeds the sheep and sells them for meat production. Meat is in high demand in Azerbaijan and Elmusa works very hard to expand his business. He works from early morning 'till late at night, pasturing his herd of sheep and the buffalos of his father. Now he would like to expand the business and start to sell milk products. For this purpose, he has applied for $1,200 USD to buy one cow, which costs $700 USD and fodder for $500 USD. The estimated cost for the cow is $700-800 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase one milky cow and fodder

loans.name: Turimin

texts.id:
Turimin, although already 67 year old, his enthusiasm toward being productive did not decline. Life’s demand had endured him through 25 years of this lime stone effort. With Rp 2.000.000 (about USD 222) – Turimin can purchase I truck load of limestone and firewood for burning the limestone to produce lime. This is performed once a week. The end result being lime powder is sold for Rp 2.400.000 (USD 266), to shrimp farmers to balance the acidity of the water. Thus generating a profit of Rp 400.000 (USD45) to support his family (wife and 6 children) until they are independent. At the moment Turimin living with his wife while his married children have jobs of their own. Thus he and his wife can concentrate on this effort to provide for their retirement and improve their current simple and basic home he owns. With this loan from DINARI plan to grow his effort by purchasing more raw materials thus increasing his profit.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Turimin sudah mencapai usia 67 tahun, tapi semangatnya untuk tetap produktif tidak pernah surut. Tuntutan hidup membuatnya bertahan dalam menjalankan usahanya mengolah batu kapur selama 25 th. Dengan modal Rp 2.000.000,- Turimin membeli 1 truk batu kapur dan kayu bakar yang dipakai mengolah batu kapur tersebut. Hal ini dilakukannya 1 minggu sekali sesuai dengan waktu yang diperlukan dlm mengolah batu kapur tersebut. Hasil olahan batu kapur yang sudah berupa bubuk dijualnya kepada pengusaha tambak udang untuk dipakai mengatur keasaman air dengan harga Rp.2.400.000,- Sehingga Turimin mendapat keuntungan Rp. 400.000 . Dari hasil usahanya inilah Turimin menanggung biaya hidup istri dan enam orang anaknya sehingga mereka bisa mandiri dengan memiliki usaha sendiri. Saat ini Turimin tinggal berdua dengan istri sedangkan anak-anaknya sudah menikah dan memiliki usaha masing-masing.Dengan demikian Turimin lebih berkonsentrasi dalam pekerjaannya bersama istri untuk kehidupan di masa tuanya dan mengadakan perbaikan atas rumah sederhana yang ditempainya saat ini. Dengan mendapat pinjaman dari DINARI Turimin berencana mengembang usahanya dengan membeli bahan baku yang lebih banyak sehingga hasilnyapun bisa meningkat.

loans.use: Purchase lime stone (Membeli batu kapur)

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. Aun K. married in 1985 and has four children, two sons and two daughters. She learned to weave silk from a friend in Koh Dach commune in Kandal province back when she was single. She started her silk production in 1983, two years before she got married. She finished the primary school in Prek Ampil village. Her husband is a construction worker, also doing farming and raising animals.

Mrs. Aun K. has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times already. Now she is asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 500. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom. Also, she will use some borrowed money so her husband can grow rice in the dry season.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom, and growing rice in the dry season.

loans.name: María Emperatriz

texts.es:
Emperatriz, as her friends call her, is a member of the community bank La Mujer Riojana. She works selling prepared food, especially juanes (chicken, rice and/or other ingredients cooked inside a banana leaf) of all varieties, including rice with pork, rice with chicken, yuca (cassava) with pork, and yuca with chicken. She prepares her juanes in her sales stall located in the central market of the town of RIoja, in the province of Rioja and the region of San Martín. In a separate space located in the street Libertad la Cdra, she sells fast food at night, including salchipapas, sausages with french fries and salchipollo, a popular fast food chicken dish with fries, and hamburgers, etc.

With the loan of 1500 soles (Peruvian currency), which she will repay in 6 months, Emperatriz will buy 12 plastic chairs, 4 sets of matching tablecloths and napkins, a sack of rice, 10 chickens raised on small farms, a sack of potatoes, and whatever other items she'll need for the expansion of her business.

Her love for her children, her dedication to them and the effort she invests in being able to give them a good education have always been the impulse for her to continue working. Her friendliness and the good service she gives her clients have allowed her to be more creative in the varieties of juanes she prepares and sells.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran. Kiva volunteer.

Emperatriz, como le llaman sus amigos, es socia del banco comunal La Mujer Riojana, se dedica a la venta de comida, especialmente juanes de todas sus variedades (de arroz con chancho, de arroz con gallina, de yuca con chancho, de yuca con gallina), ello lo elabora en su puesto ubicado en el Mercado Central de la localidad de Rioja, provincia de Rioja, región San Martín. En otro espacio ubicado Jr. Libertad la Cdra 8 vende comida rápida por las noches (salchipapas, salchipollo, hamburguesas, etc.)

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará sillas de plástico (12 unidades), cuatro juegos de manteles y servilletas, un saco de arroz, diez gallinas de chacra, un saco de papa y otras cositas más que pueda necesitar. Su amor, empeño y dedicación a sus hijos para poder darles una buena educación han sido siempre el impulso para seguir trabajando. Su cordialidad y buen trato a sus clientes le ha permitido ser más creativa en sus variedades de juanes.

loans.use: Purchase of assets for her business (plastic chairs, tablecloths and napkins). Also purchase of ingredients (rice, chicken, potatoes, etc.)

loans.name: Hector

texts.en:
Hector O., a 46 year old native of the city Roque González, has been married to Petrona Fleitas for twenty three years. They have five children. Two still attending school and the older three children have all graduated and are in the working world.

Twenty years ago, Hector began a small convenience store in his house where his wife worked while he was studying to graduate. Hector and his wife, along with their kids have all had a big part in making the convenience store a success. To continue providing for his dedicated customers he will use the loan to buy greater quantities of merchandise for the store like drinks, flour, yerba, leaves for making a tea like drink, pasta and rice.

loans.use: To buy food goods: flour, sugar, pasta, rice, yerba and selected meats.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna S. is an entrepreneur from Khoost in the far western tip of Ukraine. She runs a small women’s clothing sales business from a little space at a store “Artem” in Khoost. Anna is no stranger to difficult times. She and her husband, Nicolai, have had to deal with the tragedy of losing their only daughter. They have also lived through the challenges and uncertainties of the collapse of the Soviet Union and the new opportunities provided by an independent Ukraine. Anna started her business 3 years ago when faced with difficult life circumstances. Since that time she has done well and now makes around $1200 per month, a very good wage for her and her husband.

Anna has requested a loan of $700 to increase her working capital. In the future she hopes to expand her business by opening a second sales location. This loan will allow Anna to continue to make investments in her business and ensure its stability.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Abdona

texts.es:
For 20 years, in the municipality of Condega in the city of Estelí, Señora Abdona G. has made a living by farming, since she has her own land in her sector of the city. Since she started her business, she has received the support of her husband in the activities that they carry out. It is for this motive that she has been able to make improvements to her business and support the studies of her five children, including one girl who is still a minor.

In spite of the difficult farming work (agriculture and raising livestock), she strives greatly to continue improving her business. We can't overlook that Ceprodel has played a fundamental role since it has offered her credits that have been used to purchase and raise livestock as well as to invest in the agricultural harvest. Currently, Abdona has had 5 credits with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Desde hace 20 años en el municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí, la señora Abdona G. se dedica al negocio agropecuario teniendo su propio terreno en su sector de localidad. Desde que inició el negocio ha recibido el apoyo de su esposo en las actividades que se realizan y es por este motivo que ha venido logrando obtener mejoras que le han permitido obtener mejoras en el negocio y en el apoyo al estudio de sus cinco hijos entre ellos una niña que es la menor de edad.

A pesar del difícil trabajo agropecuario (Agricultura y ganadería), ella se esfuerza grandemente para continuar mejorando su negocio. No podemos pasar por alto que Ceprodel ha jugado un papel fundamental debido a que le ha proporcionado créditos que han sido utilizados en la compra y crianza del ganado y además en la inversión para la cosecha de agricultura. Actualmente su record crediticio es de 5 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Keeping up the farm and investing in the harvest

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
My name is Mussarat M. from Faisalabad, a mid-size city in Pakistan. I was married 16 years ago and have four kids: three boys and one girl. I have managed to enroll all my kids in school. My husband is a turner and wants to buy copper to manufacture copper rings.

I am the group leader for several other women who are also need of loans for their families' businesses. Khalida A. wants to buy a donkey cart for her husband’s fruit business. Rukhsana B. sews clothes for neighborhood clients. Lastly, Meena B.’s son is a painter.

loans.use: Buy copper to manufacture copper rings

loans.name: Martín

texts.es:
Martin Zeledon is single and has four children, two that work and two that are still in school. The youngest is fifteen years old. Martin owns his own house, which he managed to purchase with many sacrifices. He works at El Ayota as a municipal coordinator of adult literacy and education. He supervises and organizes the study groups in the urban and rural zones. He has spent seventeen years in the educational sector, always maintaining excellent relations with the students, both young and adult, as well as with the teachers who attend the groups. He gets support from his two oldest children who are now working. His dwelling does not have enough space, and he wants to provide his older children privacy and comfort. For these reasons, with this loan he will start building two bedrooms.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.
