El Sr. Martin Zeledon es soltero, tiene 4 hijos, dos ya trabajan y dos estudian, la menor tiene 15 años. Don Martin posee casa propia, la que compro con muchos sacrificios. Trabaja en EL Ayote como coordinador municipal de alfabetizacion y educacion de adultos, supervisa y organiza los nucleos de estudio en la zona rural y urbana. Tiene 17 años de laborar para el sector educativo, siempre ha mantenido excelentes relaciones con los educandos que son jovenes y adultos, al igual que con los maestros que atienden los grupos. Recibe el apoyo de sus 2 hijos mayores que ya trabajan. Su vivienda vivienda no tiene espacio suficiente y quiere brindarles a sus hijos mejores comodidades y privacidad, por eso con este crédito empezará a construir 2 cuartos de habitación.

loans.use: Construction of two bedrooms.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 36 year-old Elizabeth S.. She is married and has one child, aged 4. In 2005, Elizabeth established her crop wholesaling business. Elizabeth requires a loan in order to purchase stocks of beans from farmers or wholesalers in bulk, which she will resell at the retail level. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are deemed not creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

Thus, SELFINA works for the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of beans in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr:
Mr. Komlan T. was born in 1969 in Attitogon. He currently lives in Toulassicondji with his six children for whom he is responsible. He breeds pigs. Nicknamed “Meat Papa” by his customers, he is trying to meet the needs of meat consumers. He is seeking this loan to buy piglets and to build a pigpen. In eight months, Mr. Komlan T. will be able to sell his animals and earn enough money. The funds will be used to pay back his loan and improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur T. Komlan est né en 1969 à Attitogon. Il vit actuellement à Toulassicondji aux côtés de ses six enfants à charge. Il pratique le petit élevage de porcs. Surnommé par ses clients PAPA VIANDE, il fait aujourd’hui, un grand effort pour être à la hauteur des besoins en consommation de viande. Il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des petits porcs , de son et aménager son enclôt. Dans huit mois, Monsieur T. Komlan pourra vendre ses bêtes et gagner assez d’argent. Les fonds lui serviront à rembourser son crédit et à rendre les conditions de vie de sa famille meilleures.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Varn

texts.en:
Mrs. Varn C., 55, is a farmer who grows rice in Phteah Rung Commune, Pursat Province. She has been growing rice since 1990. She is married and lives with her husband and five children. Two children work as bricklayers. The other one is a garment worker in Phnom Penh and helps provide support for her loan repayment.

In addition to her farming business, Varn has a business selling fertilizer to other farmers in her village. She purchases fertilizer from a wholesaler and resells it for a profit, providing the fertilizer to other farmers and collecting the money for it, plus interest, when they harvest the rice. Now it is time for her to run this business. Varn would like to request a loan to run the business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer from wholesaler and resell for profit

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mrs. Kong S. was born in 1974 and now lives in Smaonh village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Ly Sok Leang, is a breeder who is raising four cows, two buffaloes, and eight pigs. The pig breeding business is going well and his pigs are growing very fast, but he does not have enough money to buy pig food for them. So his wife, Mrs. Kong S., decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food for this purpose. Mrs. Kong S. has five children: three of whom attend school, while the remaining two are too young to work or enroll in school because they are three and five years old. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy pig food.

loans.name: Karla Banessa

texts.es: La señora Karla Banessa  U. Pérez  tiene la edad de 31 años, habita en el Municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo e hijo los  niños están estudiando la secundaria, su esposo trabaja desempeñándose como  conductor de las rutas urbanas de la capital de Managua. Mientras ella se dedica a su negocio  que es la venta de ropa nueva y usada  tiene más de quince años de experiencias en las ventas de ropa, lo cual hasta ahora le ha ido bien, inicio con dinero propio que su esposo le dio. Con la solicitud de préstamos es para comprar inventario de ropa variada para niños y adultos. A futuro sus sueños es llegar a tener un tienda en la cual pueda ofrecerle al cliente las variedades de productos, a si como captar mas clientes, y hacer mejoras a su vivienda, como apoyar en los estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karla Banessa U. P. is 31-years old and lives in the town of Ticuantepe, with her husband and child who is studying in secondary school. Her husband works as a bus driver for the urban routes in the capital city of Managua. Karla is dedicated to her business of selling new and used clothes and thus far it is going well, with the money her husband has given her. With this loan she would like to buy an inventory of clothes for both children and adults. In the future, she dreams of owning her own store where she can offer her customers a variety of products, and attract more clients. She would also like to make home improvements and support her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children and adult clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fuel

loans.name: Kossiwavi Akpéné

texts.fr:
Madame T. Kossiwavi Akpéné est une femme Togolaise qui est née le 18 juin 1961 à Lomé, la capitale du pays.  Elle est mariée avec un homme qui est militaire retraité, et ils ont trois enfants.  Depuis 2000, elle a vendu des produits génériques, sacs, et chaussures à Agoè, un quartier au nord de la ville.  

Elle n’a jamais bénéficié d’un prêt au près de WAGES.  Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite va lui permettre d’acheter 6 cartons de produits génériques, 50 sacs, et 100 chaussures.  Ces types de marchandises sont  très populaires pour les cadeaux pendant les périodes de fête à la fin d’année, donc la demande est actuellement augmentée.  Avec ce nouveau stock, elle peut bien vendre et servir ses clients.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kossiwavi Akpéné T. is a Togolese woman who was born on June 18, 1961 in Lomé, the capital of the country. She is married to a man who is retired military, and they have 3 children. Since 2000 she has been selling generic products, handbags, and shoes in Agoè, a neighborhood north of the city.

She has never received a loan from WAGES. This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy 6 cases of generic products, 50 handbags and 100 pairs of shoes. This sort of merchandise is very popular as presents during the end-of-year festivities so the demand for these things is greater at present. With this new stock, she will be able to make more sales and serve her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of generic products, handbags, and shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Sophai

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophai N., 29, and her husband, Mr. Hun Hor, 33, residents of a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2001 and have two daughters.  Sophai’s mother also lives with them.

Sophai has been a silk weaver for 11 years, a skill learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then resells them in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a wooden house builder for two years, and the couple hopes that their businesses will allow their children to pursue higher education in the future.  

Sophai is now requesting a loan of $600 to purchase silk material for weaving and construction crane materials for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and construction crane materials for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo trabaja de transportista; tiene una movilidad de servicio publico Taxi inter- ciudad La Paz El Alto, actividad que es su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de su hija. Viven su casa propia ubicada en la zona de Villa Exaltación de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara al mantenimiento del motor (cambio de caja de cambios) para continuar trabajando con su herramienta de trabajo (Taxi).
 
Es el segundo crédito via Kiva, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle otro préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Guillermo works as a driver; he has a public service vehicle, Taxi, between the cities of La Paz and El Alto. This activity is his main source of income which cover the support of his daughter. He lives in his own home in the Villa Exaltacion zone of the city of EL Alto. The loan proceeds will be used for the maintenance of the vehicle motor (replacement of the gear box) which will allow him to continue using his main work tool (Taxi). This is his second loan through Kiva. His good credit record allows the approval of another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace the gear box of his taxi.

loans.name: Tuzinduke Group

texts.en:
Raya  has owned a small charcoal store and has been a perfume seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. 
She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.  She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and perfume for her business. 
She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, improve her home and save money for future use.  

Raya is 22 years old, single. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Halima. Who also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal  and perfume for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Doña Rosa tiene 52 años de edad, reside en Memorial Sandino en la ciudad de Managua, estado civil casada, su esposo es taxista tiene su vehiculo propio. Dentro de sus proyecto esta la terminación de la construcción de su casa para brindarse seguridad y protección a su pequeño hogar. Ella se desempeña como trabajadora social desde hace siete años, con esta solicitud la Señora. Rosa va ha invertir en materiales de construcción como: cemento, perlines, arena y hierro para terminar de construir y elevar el nivel del techo de su casa. Sus planes a futuro es poder seguir ayudando a los niños de la calle.
texts.en:
Rosa is 52 years old and lives in Memorial Sandino in the city of Managua. She is marreid. Her husband is a taxi driver and he has his own vehicle. Among their projects is to complete the construction of their house in order to provide security and protection to their small home. She has worked as a social worker for seven years. With this loan, Rosa is going to invest in construction materials such as cement, wood frames, sand and iron in order to finish constructing and elevating the roof level of her home. Her future plans are to be able to continue helping the street children.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials in order to finish her home.

loans.name: Hurshed

texts.ru: Хабибов Хуршед, молодой человек 24 лет, занимается продажей  запчастей и электро предметов для домашнего обихода. Кроме этого бизнеса он работает в кондитерском цехе по замесу теста. Его жена работает в детском саду помощницей воспитателя. Для  расширения своего бизнеса Хуршед хочет получить очередной кредит, закупить товар с оптового рынка. Его ассортимент составляет электрические плитки, розетки, кабеля и.т.д.
texts.en:
Hurshed H., a young man of 24 years, sells replacement parts and home electronics. In addition to this businesss, he works in a confectionary shop kneading dough. His wife works as an assistant caregiver at a daycare center. Hurshed wants to get another loan to expand his business by purchasing goods on the wholesale market. His inventory consists of electric hot plates, outlets and cables, et cetera.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Electronics

loans.name: Kikiafu 2 Nasim Kigere Group

texts.en:
Ms. Nasim K. is 36 years old and married with four kids: two girls and two boys. All her kids go to school.

Nasim has owned a school canteen for over two years. She will use this loan to improve her business selling eatables, like bread, fresh juice, soda, cakes, chapatti, madasi, and sweets. She desires to buy more equipment, like the refrigerator for cold drinks.

loans.use: To buy more equipment for her canteen.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria.
Nancy es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hija, Nancy vende repuestos de carros en un local alquilado, en donde también su esposo tiene un taller de mecánica de carros y tiene el apoyo de dos ayudantes.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos, luces y cables.
Los sueños de Nancy son comprar terreno para la construcción de su casa, mejorar su casa, tener un carro propio para salir a pasear y brindar una buena educación a su hija.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Virgin Mary Communal Bank. She lives with her common-law husband, is 24 years old, and has one daughter. Nancy sells spare car parts in a rented space, where her husband has a car mechanic workshop and employs two assistants. Nancy needs a loan of 2000 soles to invest in the purchase of car parts, lights, and cables. Nancy's dreams are to purchase land for the construction of her home, to have her own car to drive around in, and to provide a good education for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase car parts, lights, and cables

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en:
"I have a friend named Oliver. My husband and I work on his farm. Together, we till a two-hectare farm in order to provide for the needs of our family," says Aquilina A., a forty-two year old mother of two children.

She would like a loan from CEVI, one of Kiva's field partners. She will use the loan to purchase urea fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides. She also considers venturing into another line of business to help contribute to the family income.

CEVI helps small businesses to grow. They provide not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase urea fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin M. is 54 years old and is married with three children. He sells confectionery and other foodstuffs in the market and has been in this business already for nine years. This activity generates the main income for his family.

Since Elchin is very popular in the market selling the fresh and tasty pastries, he tries to maintain a wide range of goods. Thus, today, Elchin requests $1,200 for purchasing more food items to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more food products to sell

loans.name: Fonima

texts.en: Fonima L., GE 50, is married and has children.  She has 15 years of experience making and selling Chinese cookies. She sells to the general public 7 days per week. She has had five previous loans from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala.  SPBD loans are Fonima’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a gas oven for baking

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 32 years old, married and has three children attending school. She sells grocery products like rice, fresh tomatoes, tin tomatoes, cocoa products, skimmed milk, etc. in her neighborhood market. She started her business six years ago. Her experience in selling food products has made her one of the successful retailers in the market. She considers the loan a great opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy cartons of milk, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable and palm oil to increase her stock of goods available for sale.

loans.use: To buy cartons of milk, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetables etc.

loans.name: Tong

texts.en: Mr. Tong T. is a villager in Samraung village in Takeo province. He is a palm juice collector. His wife, Mrs. Kaem Nhy, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where they cultivate rice. Although they try to work hard, they still earn insufficient income to support their household. Thus, Mr. Tong T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. He hopes to increase their income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan. He has two children, one of whom is employed in a beer factory while the other stays at home to do housework. His wife is also present in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine V. is from the village of Colonia, Valencia City. She is 27 years old. Geraldine is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Geraldine owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from her sari sari (variety) retail store and pay video games. Geraldine has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Geraldine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Geraldine is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Geraldine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her retail store

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is twenty–five years old, married and has one child, a boy who is in basic school. He lives with his wife and son in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. He is a carpenter by profession. His handwork are of a class therefore he has attracted lots of customers who order furniture goods from him. Andrew makes all kinds of furniture for sale in his workshop in his community. He works very hard to be able to provide for his family.

Andrew has been in business for four years. He is requesting a loan to buy materials such as wood, glue, etc. to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more woodworking materials

loans.name: Chhoun

texts.en: Chhoun H., 44, is married and resides in Siem Reap province with her husband and four of her children. Together with her husband, she works making traditional drums to sell to dealers. They typically make about US$ 10 every day. Chhoun is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to purchase tools and materials to make more drums. (Chhoun's husband is pictured here.)

loans.use: To purchase tools and materials to make more drums

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr: Cette dame vend des produits d’alimentation générale dans le quartier de Sossoukopé à Lomé ; elle est mariée et est mère de 03 enfants. Elle a débuté cette activité depuis 1994 et ce commerce lui permet d’apporter sa contribution financière dans l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants. Elle s’approvisionne le plus souvent au Grand Marché de Lomé et vend de l’eau minérale, du vin, des boissons alcoolisées, des tomates, des pâtes alimentaires, des savons et bien d’autres produits. Elle approvisionne presque tout son voisinage en produits de première nécessité ; elle aime bien son activité et réserve de très bon accueil à sa clientèle. Elle souhaite en ce moment renouveler son stock en baisse ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle voudrait avoir  un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 03 boîtes de pâtes dentifrices, 05 cartons d’eau minérale, des bouteilles de boissons alcoolisées et des savons de différents types.

loans.use: Achat des produits d'alimentation générale

loans.name: Bibi Bekam Group

texts.en:
Bibi Bekam is the group leader of the Bibi Bekam group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their own businesses.

Bibi Bekam and Shazya want a loan for their tailoring business. They will use the loan to buy necessary materials for their business. Zabeer wants a loan for his embroidery business. And Abobakar wants a loan for his general store. They all want to see progress in their businesses and to earn more money to support their families and solve their problems. They believe that these loans can be very useful because they provide a chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy materials for a tailoring business

loans.name: Mon

texts.en: Mrs. Mon S. lives in Tuol Kandal Village, Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. Unfortunately, the rice field is infertile; consequently, she decided to ask for a loan, with which she will purchase fertilizer to support the field and to buy pesticides to kill the insects. Her husband, Mr. Bich Tith, is a fisherman and also helps her farm. Mrs. Mon S. is the mother of two children, one of whom is a pig breeder and the other of whom is studying at the local school.

loans.use: purchasing fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
L. John is the leader of his lending group in Lugazi. He is 36 years old, married, and has five children aged 5, 7, 9, 11 and 13. They are all in primary school. John also takes care of seven dependants, including orphans.
John is a hardworking man and has been a boda-boda rider for Lugazi Town Council for the past five years. He shows good customer care towards his clients. His business is seasonal, which affects his cash flow. He is able to make 20,000 UGX a week profit. He has a dream of buying his own bike so that he could earn a larger income and continue to educate his children to the last level. John is requesting a loan to purchase a cow (with a top-up from his savings) so that he could sell milk to diversify his family income.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Read works as a taxi driver serving his town and the neighboring villages. He has been working in this sector since 2007 to provide a good income for his family.

Today, Raed is requesting to borrow $1,200 to perform maintenance for his car and finalize some legal registration needed for the car.

loans.use: Maintenance for his car

loans.name: Las Cumbeñitas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal las Cumbeñitas esta formado por un grupo de hombres y mujeres que buscan mejores oportunidades para salir adelante con sus familias y entregarles un fututo digno, son oriundos de la parroquia Cumbe donde viven algunos de los socios y otros viven en diferentes localidades de la ciudad de Cuenca. En ésta localidad la mayor parte de su población se dedica a la agricultura.

La señora  Martha Ordóñez es socia activa de éste banco comunal, ella  vive  en la comunidad los Sauces en la parroquia Cumbe con su esposo que trabaja como albañil  y sus ocho hijos de  26, 24, 22, 19, 16, 14, 13, 6 años de  edad, de los cuales el primero, segundo y cuarto hijo ya trabajan y aportan con los gastos del hogar, su hijo de 22 años está casado y aún vive con ellos, sus hijos  pequeños aun son estudiantes del colegio Cumbre y la escuela Arsenio Ullaguari, nuestra socia tiene 50 años  y gracias al esfuerzo conyugal lograron construir su casa propia.

Martha se dedica a la crianza de animales como pollos, cuyes, cerdos  para la fiesta navideña esta es  una actividad que  realiza desde que era muy pequeña inculcada por sus padres y que ahora le permite generar ingresos  económicos para ayudar a mantener a su familia;  sus animales los comercializa en su comunidad o sale a la ciudad para venderlos.

Se encuentra en su segundo ciclo trabajando con  la fundación y fue incentiva a  formar parte de éste  banco por sus compañeros que ya eran miembros del  mismo, con el préstamo que realizó  va a  comprar más crías de pollos para su negocio e irlo incrementando poco a poco.

Su meta es llegar a tener un gran criadero de pollos.

Carmen Fernández es otra de las socias de éste banco, ella  vive en el sector Cristo del Consuelo en la urbe cuencana, Carmen tiene 30 años  y es madre soltera de dos  niños uno  9 años  y el otro de  7 meses, su primer hijo estudia en la escuela de la comunidad, sus hijos no son reconocidos por su padre por lo que  ella  sola los está sacando adelante, viven arrendado porque no tienen casa propia

Nuestra socia se encuentra en su segundo ciclo trabajando  con la fundación y con el crédito anterior  adquirió  frutas para su negocio, nos comenta que siempre se ha dedicado a esta actividad  porque ayudaba a su mamá desde muy pequeña y ahora  ella se hizo cargo del negocio  para mantener a sus hijos;  con el nuevo  préstamo  solicitado va a comprar naranjas, manzanas, uvas, mangos y  mas frutas para incrementar su negocio y ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.

Su meta es ver a sus hijos crecer y que lleguen a ser buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Cumbeñitas Community Bank is formed by a group of men and women who search for better opportunities to provide for their families and to offer them a better future. They are from the Cumbe parish, where some of the members live. Others live in different locations in Cuenca. Most people in town is dedicated to agriculture .

Martha is an active member of the bank. She lives in the Sauces community, in the Cumbe parish with her husband who is a mason and their eight children ages 26, 24, 22, 19, 16, 14, 13 and 6. The first, second and fourth sons already work and help with household expenses. Their 22 year old son is married and still live with them. Their youngest children are still students at the Cumbre High School and Arsenio Ullaguari school. Our member is 50 years old. Thanks to the couple's efforts they were able to build their own home.

Martha breeds animals such as chickens, guinea pigs and pigs for Christmas festivities. She has been in this activity since she was little and was taught by her parents. Now it allows her to generate income to help provide for her family. She sells her animals in her community and out of town.

She is in her second cycle working with the foundation and was encouraged to be part of this bank by her friends who were already members. With the loan she requested she will buy more chicks for her business and will keep it growing little by little.

Her goal is to have a big chicken hatchery.

Carmen is another of this bank's members. She lives in the Cristo del Consuelo sector in the Cuiencara area. Carmen is 30 years old and is the single mother of two sons, 9 years old and 7 months old. Her oldest goes to the community's school. Her sons were not recognized by their father and she supports them alone. She rents because she does not own a house.

Our member is in her second cycle working with the foundation. With her previous loan she purchase fruit for her business. She tells us that she has always been in this activity because she helped her mom when she was young. She took over the business to support her sons. With the new loan she will buy oranges, apples, grapes, mangoes and other fruit to increase her business and offer more variety to her customers.

Her goal is to see her sons grow and for them to be good professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chicks and fruits such as oranges, apples, grapes, mangoes, etc.

loans.name: Lolo

texts.en:
Lolo M. is 63 and married with 7 children (ages 5 - 36).  She owns a business venture, providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members.  Lolo has many years of experience in this business.  Lolo needs a loan of WST $1250 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 210 tala or US $88 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2008, Lolo joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Lolo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Vicitacion

texts.en:
49-year-old Visitacion is happy to share that her one-hectare rice farm has expanded and she thanks God for the additional half hectare of land to till. She and her husband Jose are hand-in-hand in making the farm productive. They both want to give their children proper education so they work hard to achieve it.

Visitacion joined CEVI, a microfinance institution that is a partner of Kiva, to get access to capital assist her in her business venture. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos, which she plans to buy farm supplies such as seed and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies such as seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Inocencio Alvarenga

texts.en: Inocencio is from Ayolas Misiones. He is a baker who specializes in sweets, such as sandwich cookies (alfajores), cakes and mini sweet pies that are packed and sold by the dozen in many stores in the city. Inocencio works with his wife in their house, which is located at Mil Viviendas Núcleo 2. The couple has two children. Inocencio is very satisfied with his work with the foundation (Fundación Paraguaya, Kiva's partner) as he has been able to develop and grow his business as a result.

loans.use: To purchase food

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en: Virgilia used to borrow her business capital from lenders who charged high interest with their loans. Her harvest from her rice farm was only enough to pay the lenders. She barely earned income for her family. She said now that she is a member of CEVI, she hopes to earn because of their lower interest rate. She said that paying back her loan will be a lot easier now compared to before. She is asking for a loan of 5000 PHP, which she will use to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other needed farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, and other needed farm supplies

loans.name: Mrs. Try Toar Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Ten people living in Pou Ta Pang village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. They will each use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Try T. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. She and her husband, Mr. Sophat P., are farmers who hire a piece of land to grow vegetables which they sell to support their family living.

This family has a problem because it’s the season to farm their vegetable field. Thus, in order to improve their production of vegetables, Mrs. Try T. decided to ask for a loan to grow vegetables this season.

Mrs. Try T. is the mother of four children, who are all in different employment such as laborer, seamstress, and chef.

loans.use: To grow vegetables

loans.name: Guardabarranco Group

texts.es:
El grupo Guardabarranco lo conforman tres féminas trabajadoras, emprendedoras y luchadoras quienes desean algún día ser como las personas que se muestran en los talleres contando historia de éxito y las cuales iniciaron desde abajo.

La coordinadora de el grupo es la señora Marielena Ernestina Gaitán Larios quien vende productos de la Avon, marca reconocida por sus ventas vía catalogo. Ella con el préstamo podrá comprar mayor cantidad de productos y obtener mayores ganancias.

Sus compañeras de grupo son María Teresa A.  la cual vende tortillas y
Marlene del Rosario P. V.  tiene una pequeña pulpería. Ellas invertirán en materia prima para sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Guardabarranco Group is comprised of three hard-working, entrepreneurial, and tenacious women. They hope that one day they will be like the people who started at the bottom and are shown in the workshops as success stories. Marielena Ernestina Gaitán Larios is the coordinator of the group. She sells Avon products, a brand known for its catalog sales. She will use the loan to buy a larger quantity of products and to get greater earnings. Her colleagues in the group are María Teresa A., who sells tortillas; and Marlene del Rosario P. Velásquez, who has a small mini-market. They will invest in raw materials for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Avon products

loans.name: Benina

texts.fr:
Cette femme a 45 ans, elle est très dynamique, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits génériques. Elle réalise de bonnes recettes. Son stock est en baisse, elle veut se réapprovisionner alors elle demande à WAGES son premier prêt pour acheter divers produits génériques.
Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants
texts.en:
This is a quite dynamic 45-year-old woman, who generates revenue by selling generic (no-brand) products. Her earnings are good, but her stock has decreased to the point where she needs to resupply. Therefore she is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy various generic products. She is married and the mother of five children.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy generic products

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal Panamericana, se reúnen cada dos semanas la Asociación Comunal LAS EMPRENDEDORAS. Se agruparon hace aproximadamente 1 año por la necesidad de contar con un capital que les permita mejorar sus negocios.
Las integrantes de esta Asociación tienen negocios como: la venta de ropa (faldas, mandiles), puertas y transporte. Todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir y fortalecer sus negocios.

Un ejemplo claro es Olga A. de 33 años, esa casada y vive en la ciudad de El Alto, zona 6 de Junio hace 13 años, ella tiene el negocio de confección de mochilas hace 5 años, cuando tiene los productos terminados los vende en diferentes ferias.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Las Emprendendoras” (The Enterprising Women) meets every two weeks at the Pan American Community Association. They gathered as a group approximately one year ago in order to access the necessary capital to improve their businesses. The members of this Association have businesses selling clothing (skirts and aprons), manufacturing doors, and providing transportation. All of them need this loan to invest in and strengthen their businesses.

One clear example is Olga A. who is 33 years old, married, and has lived in the June 6th District of the city of El Alto for thirteen years. She has been operating a business that manufactures backpacks for five years. Her finished products are sold at different fairs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria pertenece al banco comunal “La Unión de Ollantaytambo” de la Asociación Arariwa, es natural de Ollantaytambo, tiene 48 años, es casada y  tiene tres hijos. Actualmente,  Gloria se dedica a la agricultura,  ella distribuye frutas y cereales en los mercados y ya son 20 años que está en el negocio y le va muy excelente. 

Gloria es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario salir adelante, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes, abono, pesticidas y semillas. El anhelo de la socia es comprar una flota de taxis. 

Gloria se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gloria belongs to the La Unión de Ollantaytambo Communal Bank of the Arariwa Asociación. She is a native of Ollantaytambo. She is 48, married, and has three children. Gloria currently works in agriculture. She delivers fruits and grains in the markets. She has been in this business for 20 years. The business is going extremely well for her. Gloria is a hard-working and enterprising person. She is always looking for opportunities to get ahead. She puts forth daily effort to get ahead. She needs the loan to buy chemical and natural fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds. Her wish is to buy a fleet of taxis. Gloria is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chemical and natural fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds

loans.name: Dominga's Group

texts.en:
Dominga C. is from the village of Tiaman, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old and is the group leader of this three-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Dominga is married and has four adult children. She owns and operates a business making and selling food, preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Dominga joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Dominga is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn A. is from the village of Puntabon, Bonbon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 33 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp as well as dried fish, in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $125 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Puntabon, Bonbon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Abdul Razak

texts.fr: Monsieur K. a débuté en 2009 le commerce de portables et accessoires, il exerce ce commerce dans l’un des quartiers les plus animés de Lomé en commerce. Il est très connu par la qualité de ses marchandises. La demande actuel de sa clientèle est élevée raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES  un premier prêt pour acheter  des portables, des batteries, des pochettes et divers. Il est célibataire et ce commerce lui permet de pouvoir  se prendre en charge.
texts.en:
In 2009, Mr. K. began selling cellphones and accessories. He runs this business in one of the liveliest business districts in Lomé. He is very well known for the quality of his merchandise. He is seeking a first loan from WAGES to buy cell phones, batteries, cases, and miscellaneous items because customer demand has risen at this time. He is a bachelor and this business enables him to support himself.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cellphones and accessories

loans.name: Mukuza Women's Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en: K. Joachim is 44 years old and the leader of his lending group in Kyenjojo. He is a hard working and determined man. He is married with 11 children, 9 of whom are still in school. Joachim has been a farmer in Kyembogo for 10 years. His major drawback has been the poor seasons that have often affected his crops; however, he has learned to time his plantings as a result of experience. He is able to generate 150,000 UGX as monthly profits, which help so much with increased investment. He needs a loan that will help him with his plantations: to buy more seedlings and clear his farm to produce more and generate more income.

loans.use: Buying more seedlings and clearing his land for fresh plantations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase beauty products such as lipsticks and perfumes.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando S. Sr., 46 years old and married, is from the village of Alimannao, Peñablanca, Cagayan where he owns and operates a business venture providing motorcycle transport to local community members. Engaged in his business for over four years, he earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

Fernando joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to repair a motorcycle used in the business, and plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his enterprise.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a member of the Uzima loan group with Faulu Kenya. She is a 35-year-old single mother.  Her child is only three years old. 

Mary has been operating a salon for one year and has one employee.  Most of her customers are women.  She hopes to expand her business and open other business outlets in the future.  She has requested for a loan to buy seats and mirrors for her salon.

loans.use: To buy salon seats and mirrors

loans.name: Bau

texts.en: Bau T. D. is 48 years old.  She has 2 children who are attending  vocational school and college.   She has a small grocery shop at home to serve the purchasing needs of nearby villagers. Her shop has run well since 2004.  It creates a stable income for her family. Bau has been a client of Seda since 2004 and she has used loans effectively in her business. Bau wants to buy more kinds of products to meet the increasing demand of her customers and is requesting a loan of 7630000 VND for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy more kinds of products to meet needs of her customers.

loans.name: Juana Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE MURUHUAY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Juana Elizabeth; ella tiene 51 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de confección y venta de chompas, ella confecciona y también compra algunas chompas para mujer, varón y niños y lo vende en forma independiente a las diferentes tiendas, la socia quiere tener una tienda para que pueda vender las chompas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar las chompas y también para comprar materiales para tejer las chompas.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “SEÑOR DE MURUHUAY.” The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Juana Elizabeth. She is 51 years old and is a single mother of one son. The member alternates her daily activities between her tailoring business and selling sweaters. She tailors and also buys some women's sweaters and sells them independently in different stores. The member wants to have a store where she can sell the sweaters. The member is requesting this loan to buy sweaters and also to buy materials to weave sweaters. 

The member thanks the people who help her achieve this dream and she promises to fulfill the payments in the established period.

loans.use: The member requests this loan to buy sweaters and also to buy materials to weave sweaters.

loans.name: Ayaa

texts.en: Ayaa M. currently earns a living by selling beer and by offering "boda-boda" taxi service on  her motorbike.  She is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Ayaa is 23 years old and married to a businessman.  She has 3 children, who all attend school.  With the extra profits generated from this loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Stephen Kabati

texts.en:
Stephen is 47 years old and is married to Mary Wairimu.  They have three children. Stephen has been in the poultry business for a period of two years with a monthly profit of about Kshs 12,000.  

Stephen has no history with any other micro finance institution and was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend. 

He will use the loan to buy poultry feeds. The accumulated savings will be used to expand his farming activities. He hopes to educate his children and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 28-year-old married woman and the mother of two school-age children. She is from Lebanon. She established a tailoring business in her home in 2003. She is specialized in producing handicrafts and embroidery.  She raises her children alone because her husband travels out of the country to work and earn income for his family.  She decided to have her own business to support her husband with the heavy family expenses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $900 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional merchandise to expand her production and her income. In the future, she hopes to open a formal gadget shop where she can sell her hand made products.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise to expand her production and her income

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Mr. Sao H. (who is in the photo with his wife) is 34 years old and his wife, Mrs. Khum Phary is 24 years old, live along national road number one about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 2006 and they a young daughter.  

Sao has been driving a motordub (motor taxi) for four years.  His wife is hired by villagers to farm.  She gets paid with fees. 
Sao’s motorbike is old and breaks down often, which costs him a lot of money to make repairs.  He could not manage his income to support his family.  Hence he has decided to ask for his first loan of $500 to purchase a new one.

loans.use: To replace his motorbike with a new one.

loans.name: Damaris Carolina

texts.es: Damaris tiene 27 años su actividad económica es venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es una actividad que le gusta mucho pues todos los días se levanta muy temprano, para realizar su labor y ofrecerlos a sus clientes. Damaris es una mujer muy responsable y que disfruta de su trabajo ya que por medio de él ha podido mantener a sus hijos, que están a su cargo y con mucho esfuerzo le ha brindado lo necesario. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es seguir adelante con este negocio que su único medio de vida.
texts.en:
27-year old Damaris has earned her living selling general merchandise for more than eleven years. It’s a job she really likes. She gets up early every morning to go to work and serve her customers.

Damaris is a very responsible woman who enjoys her work. It has enabled her to support her children, and by working hard she has provided them with the basic necessities. She is seeking a loan to buy more essential goods. Her goal is to continue with this business which is her only means of earning a living.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Jephitha Mogere

texts.en: Jephitha Mogere M. is 41 years old, married, and has three children. He has been in the electronic business for the last four years. This is his second loan from KADET LTD and he plans to purchase more electronic items for his business. With the anticipated profits, he plans to open another business. His dream for the future is to open another electronics shop.

loans.use: To purchase more electronic items

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Manuel C. M. trabaja como Técnico en Telefonía en una empresa de acueductos y alcantarillados, desde hace 11 años.

Es casado de 53 años de edad, con dos personas a su cargo las cuales están en edad escolar, vive en la ciudad de Managua en el municipio de Managua desde hace 25 años.

Este es el primer crédito en CEPRODEL lo solicita para Reparación de vivienda y darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel C. M. has worked as a telephone repairman for an aqueduct and sewerage company for the past 11 years. 

He is 53 years of age, married and has two school aged children. He has lived in the city of Managua in the Managua municipality for 25 years.

This is the first loan that he has applied for with CEPRODEL. He is requesting this loan to make repairs on his home and in turn give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Zaida Lideth

texts.es: Zaida Lideth tiene 25 años, tiene su negocio que es una pulpería, está ubicada en su vivienda, en donde la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a comprar los diferentes productos que ofrece, Zaida es una mujer muy emprendedora que disfruta de este medio de vida y al mismo tiempo de interactuar con sus clientes. El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, granos básicos, detergentes entre otros. Ella siempre desea seguir trabajando y mejorar sus ingresos  ya que tiene 1 hijo a su cargo que todavía depende de ella.
texts.en:
Zaida Lideth is 25 years old. Her business is a store in her home where most of her customers come to buy the different products she offers.

Zaida is an enterprising woman who enjoys her job and interacting with her customers. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy candy, soft drinks, bread, basic grains, detergents, and other items. She wants to continue working and improving her income because she has a child who is still dependent on her.

loans.use: Operating capital for purchasing candy, soft drinks, bread, basic grains, detergents, and other items

loans.name: Jose Leonzo

texts.es: El señor José Leonzo es un pequeño agricultor del municipio de Ticuantepe, casado con una comerciante del mismo municipio junto a su tres hijos en edades de 26 a 20 años ya casados e independiente,  los planes  a futuro es poder establecer un pequeños sistema de riego  para su cultivo de hortaliza que será de un gran beneficios para él , desde hace 40 años don José se dedica al cultivo de piña .La mayor dificultad es el daño de los gases del volcán ,la baja de precio en la piñas y otros factores que afectan la misma ; el inicio esta actividad agrícola gracias al apoyo de las tierras que le brindo su papá para que las trabajara y poder sostener a su familia .Don José necesita financiamiento para poder aplicar plaguicidas y fertilizantes .Ya que obteniendo mejores recursos podrá vender a un mejor precio y pagar lo que se le prestado en tiempo y forma .
texts.en: Mr. Jose Leonzo is a small farmer in the municipality of Ticuantepe.  He is married to a businesswoman in the same town and together they have three children between the ages of 20 and 26, all married and independent.  His future plans are to be able to establish a small irrigation system for his food crops which would be very beneficial to him.  For 40 years, Jose has cultivated pineapple.  The major challenges are damage from volcanic gases, the low prices of pineapple, and other factors that affect it.   He began this agricultural activity thanks to the help of his father who gave him land so that he could work on it and sustain his family.  Jose needs a loan to be able to apply pesticides and fertilizers, since with better resources he'll be able to sell at a higher price and pay the loan back on time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and supplies

loans.name: Younis

texts.en: Younis is currently in business selling charcoal. She is 45 years old, married to a driver, with four children and all of them go to school. Younis borrowed a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. She hopes to build a house with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more charcoal to sell

loans.name: La Esperanza 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Elena is the coordinator of her group, La Esperanza 2, 3 & 4 (Hope). She lives in the city of La Romana, where the sugar cane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

Elena has been working for 13 years. At the start, she was selling miscellaneous products. Now she is running a butcher shop where she sells all kind of meats and sausages.  She also runs a vegetable stall in her community. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase meats.

She lives with her six children and their father. Her most difficult challenges are to buy her house and to have an improved business with increased income to help with her family's expenses. Thank you for your support!.

loans.use: To purchase meats

loans.name: Aslan

texts.ru:
Aslan H. yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Mahbudlu-1, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey. Aslan 54 qoda. On uje 12 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom. Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Aslana v perviy raz on bral 2500$ za etu ssudu on ochen blagodaren lendderam i Kive.
Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa. On delayet kefir i yogurt iz moloka i prodayet ix v maqazini.
texts.en:
Aslan H. is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person). He is a refugee from Mahbudlu-1 who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his family.  He is married and has three children.  Aslan is 54 years old.  He has been a herdsman for twelve years.  This is the second loan Aslan has taken.  The first was for $2500, and he is very grateful to Kiva lenders for it.

Now, he needs 2300 AZN to buy cows which will expand his business.  He makes kefir and yogurt and sells them in shops.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married and has grown children. She is a small market entrepreneur from Novaya Kahovka. Irina sells sport shoes and sport clothing in one of the local markets. Irina rents a small facility that serves as a vending outlet. 

She says that she started this business because it was the only way to survive when her family was going through some challenging financial times. Irina has been in this business for 9 years. Irina enjoys her business, has a long-term view of her venture development and is disciplined with all her business plans. 

Irina has used micro-loans in the past and found them very helpful for her business. This time Irina is requesting a 20,000 Grivnyas loan to purchase 200 pairs of sport shoes and 50 items of various sport clothing.

loans.use: to purchase 200 pairs of sport shoes and 50 items of various sport clothing

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 56 years old and is married with 6 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Yolanda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and bamboo for her fishing business.

Yolanda has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to purchase another fishing boat for her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets and bamboo

loans.name: Mitzi Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia es una mujer de 39 años de edad, que vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en la provincia de Chepén – La Libertad.  Patricia siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer activa y trabajadora.

Actualmente Patricia tiene una bodega en la que vende abarrotes y golosinas. Su bodega está ubicada en su propio domicilio y la apertura desde hace un año y medio. Patricia es una mujer con deseos de superación y ella desea invertir en su negocio para crecer en un futuro.

Ella solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mercadería (arroz, azúcar y golosinas) para surtir su negocio y aumentar sus ventas. A pesar de que la tienda de Patricia tiene poco tiempo , esta  ya cuenta con clientela fija.

Patricia ha cancelado con puntualidad el crédito que, anteriormente, nuestra entidad le otorgó.
texts.en:
Patricia is a 39-year-old woman who lives with her parents and siblings in the province of Chepen-La Libertad. Patricia has always stood out as a active and hard-working woman.

At present, Patricia has a general store in which she sells groceries and sweets. Her store is located in her home and it opened just 1 and ½ years ago. Patricia is a woman with the drive to get ahead and she wants to invest in her business in order to grow in the future.

She is requesting through Edpyme Alternativa a loan for 1,000 new sols to buy merchandise (rice, sugar, and sweets) to supply her business and expand her sales. In spite of the fact that her store has existed only a short time, it already can count on a fixed clientèle. 

Patricia has punctually paid off her previous loan granted by our institution.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to supply her general store.

loans.name: Mirna De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Mirna D. los Ángeles, D. treinta y tres años D. edad, vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos los cuales asisten a una escuela cerca D. su residencia. Ella posee bazar y sastrería el cual es muy visitado por las personas del lugar, pues la conocen por su excelente calidad D. trabajo y su novedad D. estilos al confeccionar ropa, además  satisface las necesidades D. muchas otras personas ya que venD. variedad D. artículos en el bazar; para Mirna entre más razones se le presenten que le impidan trabajar ella busca mil razones más para estar siempre desempeñando su labor  es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar telas y artículos varios para el bazar como ropa, cosméticos, ganchos, agujas, hilos,  entre otros. Es así como Mirna lograra llevar el sustento a su hogar para darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Mirna D. los Ángeles, 33, lives with her life companion and their children who attend a nearby school.  She has a store and a tailor shop which is very popular with the locals because they know about the excellent work she does and the stylish models of clothing she makes.  Besides, she meets the needs of many other people because she sells a large variety of articles in the store.  

For Mirna, the more reasons that come up to prevent her from working, she finds thousands of reasons to be carrying out her work always and this is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy fabric and various items for the store like clothes, cosmetics, hooks, needles, and thread, among others.  This is how Mirna manages to proviD. sustenance for her home and proviD. her family with a fulfilled life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, cosmetics, hooks, needles and thread.

loans.name: Set

texts.en:
Set, 23 years old, resides with her husband and children at Siem Reap province. This couple has worked in construction since 2003. Their income is $7 per day. She has two children, 5 and 3 years old. One is studying. 

Each month, she has to spend US $50 on food, US $3 on utilities and US $15 on other expenses. 

Set would like to ask a loan of US $650 to purchase a motorbike for traveling to work. This loan will facilitate her going to work or somewhere else and reduce the cost of motor taxis. 

In the future, she hopes her children will get a higher education and she will have a good living standard.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for traveling to work.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Uganda. She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. Margaret has had a restaurant for five years, and she works seven days out of every week.

Margaret has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, rice, beef, and charcoal. The main business challenges for Margaret include seasonality and the ever-increasing price of food in Uganda. 

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully-stocked restaurant. Margaret lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include electricity bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas, rice, beef and charcoal

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
Confiadas que unidas podrían alcanzar sus metas y con el apoyo mutuo, en la ciudad de Caaguazú se formo un comité llamado Primavera, con 20 señoras humildes y trabajadoras con el fin de obtener un pequeño ingreso para cubrir las necesidades de los hogares de cada una.
Ellas se definen como mujeres luchadoras y trabajadoras, tratan de llevar el pan de cada día por medio del esfuerzo mutuo y la cooperación.
La Sra Mary tiene un pequeño almacén que le sirve de sustento, por medio de el logra cubrir las mínimas necesidades de la familia. Sueña con algún día poder ampliar su negocio para tener mas espacio donde exponer sus mercaderías.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de bebidas, comestibles, lácteos y demás para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Certain that as a united group they could achieve their goals and with mutual support, a committee called 'Primavera' (Spring) was established in the city of Caaguazú.  The group is made up of 20 humble and hard-working ladies who have the common goal of making a small income to cover their household needs.

The members of this committee describe themselves as tenacious and hard-working women who try to earn a daily living through their mutual effort and cooperation.

Mary owns a small store with which she supports herself.  Through her business, she manages to cover the basic needs of her family.  She dreams of some day expanding her business so that she can have more space in which to display her merchandise.

Mary is requesting a loan to buy drinks, food, dairy products, etc. with which to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks, food, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Aron

texts.en:
Aron is 42 years old and married with six children between 2 and 19 years old. He is a farmer from Eldoret town in Rift Valley, Kenya where he has been farming for 10 years. His mixed farm produces potatoes, maize, vegetables and milk, which he sells at the local market. Farming has been his only source of income.

Aron has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy chickens and chicken feed. The extra income from this project will enable him to improve his family's livelihood. He faces the challenge of fluctuation in the prices of farm produce, which affects his cash flow. He hopes that in the next five years, he will have improved his dairy cows to the pedigree level.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 44 years old, male and married with two children attending school. They live in Dalaoig, Alcala, Cagayan. The primary source of income for the village comes from planting and harvesting rice and corn for future merchandise. Elsie and his wife have been engaged in rice production for almost 12 years now, which provides them an income every harvest season twice a year. Elsie usually earns about PHP 15,000 each harvest season.

Due to the expensive cost of farm inputs, he is asking for a loan to have additional capital to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. With the help of this loan, he can improve his crop production.
 
In the future, he would like to continuously educate his children and earn a degree for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is a married man who lives in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, rent, and electricity.

For the past five years, he has operated a bread selling business, selling door-to-door to retailers. He faces the major challenge of competition, and high transportation costs in his business. Boniface dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the KES 40,000, he wants to purchase a bicycle to be used in bread distribution for the business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a bicycle to be used in bread distribution for the business.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 30 years. She is a widow, 67 years old, and has three children.  

She was introduced to KADET Ltd.  by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Beth hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Dinara's Group

texts.en: Dinara is the leader of this group. She is 46 and married to an engineer. Together with her husband, she has raised two sons and a daughter. The sons are farmers and the daughter studies at school. The family cultivates agricultural products and breeds livestock to earn money for a livelihood. Selling part of the harvest, Dinara earns about 5,000 soms per month. With money received from this loan, she wants to increase her livestock. In the future, Dinara wishes to build a house for her older son. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young and ambitious socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Aizat's Group

texts.en:
Aizat is the treasurer of this group. She is 26 and married to a driver, whose monthly salary is 13,000 soms. Together with her husband, she brings up two children, both of whom are preschool age (under seven).  At the moment, Aizat has saved 55,000 soms.  She is applying for the loan because she needs some additional funds to purchase hosiery to start a trade in the local market. In the future with the profits gained from the trade she plans to purchase a container (shipping container converted to a home or market stall).

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase hosiery to sell

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is a 38 year old woman who is married with two sons and a daughter. Her husband is an employee of the Palestinian National Authority.  Randa is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead at the FATEN branch.


Randa wants to improve her house so that she may live with her family in better conditions. She is requesting a 3,000 USD loan to make changes to her tiles, windows, doors, etc. When she receives her loan, which is repaid in monthly installments, she will renovate her home to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to improve her house

loans.name: Felisa

texts.es: La señora Felisa  se dedica a la venta de comida y también a la producción de leche; su esposo es chofer en transporte pesado. Con el dinero del crédito cubrirá el costo de compra insumos como ser fideo, arroz, papas, carne, etc., para su negocio de venta de comida. Vive en casa de propia ubicada en la localidad de Palomar. Felisa es casada y no  tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que la cliente obtiene un crédito.
texts.en: Felisa sells food and is also a dairy farmer.  Her husband is a heavy transport driver.  She will use the money from the loan to cover the cost of purchasing ingredients like noodles, rice, potatoes, meat, etc. for her food vending business.  She lives in her own house located in Palomar.  Felisa is married and has no children.  This is the first time the client has obtained a loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food preparation.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a hardworking business woman, aged 47. She is married and blessed with two children who are in school. For the last ten years, she has been running a grocery  business to support her family. She also sells used clothes to earn more income.  

Gladys has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more cabbages for resale. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: buy cabbages to resell

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela, de 47 años, es madre soltera. Cuida de su hijo Jeanpier en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el distrito de Tambo. Su principal característica es su vitalidad y ganas por salir adelante. Los años no pasan en ella, pues necesita tener todas las fuerzas para sacar adelante a su hijo, que es un niño con muchas habilidades. Por ello desea brindarle una buena educación; su principal actividad es la venta de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles, donde ofrece dulces, bebidas y comida rápida. Le va muy bien en su trabajo tanto así que ahora desea abrir un restaurante a la vez. Todo esto gracias al lugar donde queda su fuente de soda, que es estratégico por la afluencia de personas que ya conocen de la buena sazón que tiene. Ahora ella desea sacar el máximo provecho a las fiestas navideñas. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “rompiendo fronteras” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Adela de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Adela, who 47 years of age is a single mother. She looks after her son Jeanpier at her parents’ house, situated in the district of Tambo. Her main characteristic is her vitality and her yearning to come out ahead. The years don’t pass her by as she needs to give her son a good start in life given that he is a very talented child. Because of this, she wants to provide him with a good education; her primary activity is the sale of basic products from her grocery store, where she sells sweets, drinks and quick food. 

Her work is going very well, so much so that she now wants to open a restaurant. All this is thanks to the place where she has set up her soda foundation as it is a strategic location due to the amount of people who know how tasty it is. Now she wishes to take full advantage of the festive season (Christmas).

She belongs to the community bank “Rompiendo Fronteras” (“Breaking Boundaries”) and this is their sixth loan with MFP, where they await your contribution to continue pursuing their goals. Adela promises to once more pay off her loan repayments. She also likes being part of a communal bank as all of its members are responsible and caring people. Adela will use the money received for the purchase of basic products for her store.

loans.use: purchase of basic products for her store.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.es: Rosana, de 29 años, natural de Santa Rosa; es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en casa alquilada junto a su esposo Gelacio de 33 años y sus 02 queridos hijos. Lo que más desea es brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. La actividad principal de Rosana es dedicarse a la agricultura, actividad que lo realiza desde hace 10 años, pues se dedica al cultivo de cacao. Ella trabaja con ayuda de su esposo y  jornaleros, ya que su producto es rentable por que sus granos de cacao son de primera calidad y los vende a buen precio. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que puede vender fácilmente su producto y considera que lo más difícil es no poder ofrecer una casa propia para su familia. Con el tiempo aspira construir su casa, para así brindarles un techo propio a su familia. Este será su crédito número 05 con MFP y está muy contenta por darles ese apoyo para que pueda concretar con sus planes. Por otro lado está dispuesta a seguir pagando sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles podrá comprar materiales de construcción como: fierros, cemento, ladrillo, para poder construir su casa.
texts.en:
Rosana, aged 29, is a native of Santa Rosa.  She is a very happy and hard-working woman, who lives in a rented home with her husband, Gelacio, aged 33, and their two much-loved children.  What she wants most in life is to provide her family with a better quality of life.

Rosana's main activity is working in agriculture, which she has been doing for the last ten years.  She farms cocoa beans.  She works with the help of her husband and day-laborers, and her crops are profitable as her cocoa beans are of top quality and sell for a good price.

What she likes most about her work is that she can easily sell her cocoa beans, and what she considers most difficult is that she is not able to provide her family with their own home.  With time, she hopes to build a house so as to be able to put their own roof over her family's heads.

This will be her fifth loan from MFP, and she is very happy for this support to help her plans become reality.  She is also ready to continue making her repayments.  With the 1,000 new soles, she will be able to purchase construction materials such as iron, cement, and brick so she can build her home.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, and iron to build her home.

loans.name: Vasale B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Vasale B Group in Western Kenya! Biliah is the facilitator of the Vasale B group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Biliah takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season,  Biliah had a very good maize yield, harvesting 9 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Biliah was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to  Biliah  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales,  Biliah will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.
