In 2012, the members of Vasale B group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The picture shows  Biliah and her group with the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a married woman with eight children. She earns a living selling viands to her community. She also sells bananas. Patricia earns 4,500 PHP per month with her activities. She works hard to support her family.

Patricia has requested this loan to buy ingredients such as pork and chicken meat, oil, vegetables and spices. Patricia hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as pork and chicken meat, oil, vegetables and spices.

loans.name: Karin Group

texts.es: Martha  es una de las integrantes de la alcancía comunal Karin conformada por ocho miembros los cuales todos radican en el mismo  distrito. Una alcancía con grandes valores  y dedicación en cada puesto de trabajo en los que se desempeñan, así se caracteriza este grupo comunal.  Martha  de 49 años de edad tiene 2 hijos que a un depende de ella por lo cual decidió hace ya 15 años trabajar en limpieza en una posta médica, El cual le ha dado mucha estabilidad económica para ella  y para su hogar, ella comenzó en este trabajo a raíz de que recibió el apoyo de su esposo pudiendo así  trabajar juntos, este trabajo le ha podido dar satisfacciones como la financiación de la educación de sus hijos y mejoras para su casa. Con el reciente préstamo piensa invertirlo en materiales para mejoras de su hogar.
texts.en: Martha is one member of the Karin Communal Bank, which is comprised of eight members who all live in the same district. The group is characterized by it's members' good values and dedication to the work that each pursues. Martha is 49 years old and has two children who depend on her. They are the reason that she decided 15 years ago to start working as a janitor at a medical post. Her job has provided her and her household with a lot of economic stability. Martha started this job as a result of the support she received from her husband, since they could work together this way. The job has given Martha satisfaction because it has financed her children's education as well as improvements to their home. With this most recent loan, she plans to invest in materials to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy materials for home improvements

loans.name: Sarors

texts.en:
Sarors, 38, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a sculptor. Her husband is a clothes seller. One of her children is a garment worker. 

In order to expand her husband's business, she would like to request a loan of USD 1,200 to raise capital by buying more fashionable clothes to sell. This would make more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to invest more money in her husband's business to run a clothing shop and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to buy more fashionable clothes to sell

loans.name: Darwin

texts.es: Darwin, de 36 años, es un hombre que le gusta mucho estar a lado de su familia y trabajar mucho para poder brindarles una mejor calidad vida, es padre de tres hijos Robinson de 15, Rubi de 8 y Gisel de 4. JUntos habitan en su casa propia en donde también comparte su vida a lado de su esposa Nelly de 25 años. Darwin es un hombre que le gusta mucho ser precavido y en su trabajo es importante tener siempre calma y sobre todo buen tino para hacer las cosas. Pues él se dedica al transporte de pasajeros y algunas cargas dentro y fuera de la ciudad. Tiene una mototaxi que pudo comprarse en base a esfuerzo y mucho sacrificio ya que antes tenía que alquilar y así no le dejaba mucha ganancia. Lleva realizando su trabajo por 15 años y en todo ese tiempo ganó mucha experiencia y además aprendió que el cliente siempre tienes que llevarlo con paciencia sobre todo con mucha seguridad. Le esta yendo muy bien en lo que hace, tiene muchas personas que lo contratan a veces por horas enteras para transportarlos y así obtiene más ganancias, ahora se esta preparando para poder incrementar su trabajo y comprar una mototaxi más para alquilarlo y tener un ingreso adicional. Este será el crédito número 4 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, además se compromete una vez mas en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, lo utilizará para poder refaccionar algunas piezas de su mototaxi que por el tiempo y el mal estado de la calles se empezaron a deteriorar.
texts.en:
Darwin, who is 36 years old, is a man who likes to spend time with his family and works hard to be able to provide them with a better quality of life. He is the father of three children: Robinson (15 years old), Rubi (8 years old) and Gisel (4 years old). He lives in his own home with his children and his wife Nelly, who is 25 years old. 

Darwin is a man that likes to be cautious and in his work it is important to always be calm and above all have good sense to do things. He makes a living transporting passengers and deliveries inside and outside the city. He has a moto taxi that he was able to buy due to hard work and much sacrifice. Before he was renting a moto taxi and was not left with much profit. He has been in this line of work for 15 years and in all of this time he has gained much experience and has learned that he needs to transport each customer with patience and above all safety. 

He is doing well in what he does. He has many customers that hire him to transport them for hours at a time, which gives him more profits. Now he is preparing to be able to increase his business and buy another moto taxi to rent out and have an additional source of income. This is the 4th loan that he has taken out through MFP. It is his hope that with continued support he will be able to continue with his goals. He promises to make his payments on time as he has done with previous loans. With the amount of 1000 soles he will use the money to repair some parts on his moto taxi that as a result of the weather and the bad condition of roads have begun to deteriorate.

loans.use: to pay a mechanic to fix parts on his moto taxi.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is a small scale petty trader who sells gari, vegetables, food stuffs and yam in Ve GoloKwati (near Hohoe). She has had some form of formal education as she is a senior high school graduate. She is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a teaching assistant. Comfort has been working as a petty trader for close to 5 years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of gari and yam business since they moved faster than any of her whores, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a table stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of gari and yam business since they moved faster than any of her whores, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands

loans.name: Mujeres De Buena Fe Comalapa Group

texts.en:
The 7 women of “Mujeres de Buena Fe”, or “Women of Good Faith”, trust bank live in the town of San Juan Comalapa, in Central Guatemala that is known for its beautiful Cakchiquel paintings and its indigenous population that has remained strong despite the a difficult history of Spanish colonization in the area.

Vidalia is one of the youngest members of her trust bank, with just 22 years of age, and a is mother to a 3-year-old little boy. With her 6th grade formal education and the informal education she has received throughout her life, this intelligent woman has built her own small business, hand-weaving and embroidering huipiles, traditional blouses, to sell locally and to order outside of Comalapa. With a dream to expand her weaving business and start raising chickens and growing corn, as well, Vidalia plans to invest her loan in buying chicks and seeds, in addition to the threads and other materials she will purchase for her artisany.

The majority of the women in this group are artisans, creating intricate and gorgeous typical clothing and fabrics to sell in San Juan Comalapa and outside of their town, as well. In addition to weaving and embroidery, the ladies raise animals, grow corn and other vegetables, and care for their families alongside their husbands, providing education and well-being to between 1 and 7 children. With between 22 and 45 years of age, many of the group members could only study several grades in primary school, but they are all forging ahead with confidence and determination, soliciting credit from Friendship Bridge and Kiva in an effort to make up for the opportunities they were denied, building upon the limited resources they have with the tools these organizations provide them.

loans.use: buying chicks and seeds, in addition to the threads and other materials she will purchase for her artisany.

loans.name: Rustamjon

texts.ru: Рустам ответственный муж и честный отец. Ему 38 лет. Он из района Хамадони. Рустам живет вместе с женой и детьми. Рустам занимается животноводством. Он покупает скота и откармливает их в течение определенного времени, потом перепродает их на скотном рынке. 5 лет Рустам выращивает крупнорогатого скота у себя во дворе. Доход о т животноводческой деятельности обеспечить его семью. Рустам хочет расширить деятельность. Он просит кредит для купли несколько скота и корм для них. Рустаму нужна Ваша поддержка. Он заранее выражает свою благодарность.

loans.use: Для купли несколько скота и купли корм для скота.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
"This business is a member of the Future Fruit Women group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff"

Jane is single and lives in Kiserian. She is 42 years old, a secondary school graduate.

She has been in this business of rearing chicken for the last 6 years. The business has been doing well and she sells chicks, layers and broilers in Kiserian town. She is now an established supplier of broilers in the area.

loans.use: A loan of USD225 will be used to expand her rearing area and to add on the number of chicken.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO PURCHASE A DAIRY COW

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah has been a client of Kraban Support Foundation for years now. She has had several training sessions on simple record keeping and loan management from the organization. She sells agricultural produce such as cassava and plantain. She is seeking a loan of $750.00 from Kiva to help her expand her sales.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is 30 years old and is married with 3 children. Her husband is a salesman and goes house-to-house selling electrical products that people pay for in weekly instalments. Juana makes linen clothes that she sews patterns onto. She gives them to salespeople who take them to the cities most popular with tourists where people like them a lot because of the pretty patterns. She belongs to the group ‘Gladiola 7’ and the other members are: Juana S. G. (artisan) and Martha Gonsalez S. (artisan). With the loan they hope to buy large quantities of threads and materials to share out and cover the cost of buying them.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Volunteer Translator

JUANA TIENE 30 AÑOS , CASADA TRES HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO COMERCIANTE VENDIENDO ARTICULOS ELECTRICOS DE CASA EN CASA CON SISTEMA DE ABONOS SEMANALES. ELLA SE DEDICA A CONFECCIONAR ROPA DE VESTIR DE MANTA QUE LUEGO SE BORDAN Y SE VENDEN CON MAYORISTAS QUE LO LLEVAN A COMERCIALIZAR A CIUDADES TURISTICAS DONDE SON MUY APRECIADOS POR LA BELLEZA DE SUS BORDADOS . PERTENECE AL GRUPO GLADIOLA SIETE Y SUS OTRAS INTEGRANTES SON : JUANA S. G. ( ARTESANA ) MARTHA GONZALEZ S. ( ARTESANA ) . CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERAN INVERTIR EN COMPRAR GENEROS , HILOS Y MANTA EN CANTIDADES GRANDES PARA DESPUES REPARTIRSE Y ABARATAR COSTOS DE COMPRA.

loans.use: To sell crafts/VENTA DE ARTESANIA

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara is a hard worker, is married and has 4 children ages 8, 12, 15 and 18; all are students. Sara is dedicated to the sale of traditional arts and crafts. This business was established 25 year ago and was handed down to Sara and her husband by her in-laws. Her children help during busy times such as religious holidays. They joined a commercial union five years ago and have since acquired a stand that has helped their business grow.

During this time of the year, with holidays approaching, Sara’s sales increase considerably. Sara is requesting a loan of $ 700 that will be used for the purchase of merchandise to keep up with the increasing demand of her customers. She promises to pay off the loan in only 3 months. Please contribute to the growth of this business and the wellbeing of Sara and her family. They greatly appreciate your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Sara es muy trabajadora, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos, de 8, 12, 15 y 18 años de edad, todos ellos estudian. Sara se dedica a la venta de artesanías, este negocio ya tiene 25 años anteriormente era de sus suegros y ahora Sara y su esposo se encargan de él, y reciben ayuda de sus hijos en temporadas altas como en fiestas religiosas. Hace cinco años se adhirieron a la unión de comerciantes y lograron adquirir el puesto que ahora tienen, donde les ha ido mucho mejor con sus ventas y han crecido mucho.

En estos momentos que se aproximan fecha especiales, donde se incrementan las ventas considerablemente y Sara está solicitando un préstamo de $ 700 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en solo 3 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio y al bienestar de Sara y su familia, ellos agradecen mucho la confianza y apoyo que depositas en su negocio.

loans.use:
Merchadise Purchase

Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Abong

texts.en:
Abong N. is married to Chubi Peter and is a mother five children, four of whom are below the age of 15.  Her husband’s low salary not being enough to cater for the needs of these children, N. saw the need to start a business. 

With a loan of $100, she plans to start a business selling commonly consumed food stuff like rice, corn, salt, magi, garri etc.  She plans to pay her children’s school fees with the profit.  She plans to repay the loan in 15 months with the first installment on the day the loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Purchase garri, rice, salt, magi and beans to start her business

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana has a small sales business located at the central grocery market in Kolomiya, Ukraine, near Ivano-Frankivsk. She sells a variety of bedding supplies as well as a selection of pajamas. In business for two years, she has built up about $2400 worth of inventory and makes about $600 in profit per month. Svetlana has a good location at the center of her market. Because the market is primarily a grocery market there are no other competitors selling the same items as Svetlana, so the demand is high for her products. Svetlana is not married but plans to get married next year. Her business is her main means of supporting herself.

Svetlana has requested a loan to increase her inventory of bedding, blankets and pajamas. She has been a good client with Nadiya Ukraine in the past. We are glad for another opportunity to assist her with her business and livelihood.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
Emma is a member of the Community Bank Mujeres de Grandes Retos. She buys and sells baby animals (cuy, rabbit, chicken), and her business is located on Raymondi avenue in the city of Huarez, in the Ancash department of Peru.

With this loan fo 2000 soles, which will be paid back over the course of 4 months, she will buy 50 cuyes, 20 chickens and 20 rabbits

Emma is 45 years old, and is the mother of 4 children. Her oldest child is 23, and continues to study. Her other children are in primary school, and her husband works with the board. Both of them contribute to the household income.

Translated to English by a Kiva Volunteer

La señora Emma pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Grandes Retos, se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores (cuy, conejo, gallinas), su negocio esta ubicado en la avenida Raymondi de la ciudad de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con este préstamo S/. 2,000.00 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 50 cuyes, 20 gallinas y 20 conejos. .

La señora Emma tiene 45 años y es madre de 4 hijos, el mayor tiene 23 años, cursa estudios superiores, los otros tres están en educación primaria, su esposo trabaja en el consejo en forma eventual y ambos contribuyen a los gastos del hogar.

loans.use: To purchase baby animals such as chickens and rabbits

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima lives in a small place, Litve, near the town Živinice. She is married and she has one son, 13 years old. He goes to primary school. Her husband is a self-employed driver. Their monthly income is about US$ 750, as they have a shop selling mixed goods and she owns some livestock. Their income is not enough to maintain the shop and feed their livestock, however.

Fatima has requested her first loan at MCO WWI in the amount of US$ 600 and she is going to invest in her shop by buying more goods. She is hoping that this loan will improve her business activity and thus she will improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her small store

loans.name: Leila Marina

texts.es:
With a lot of hard work, Leila works as a housekeeper in the El Sauce district in León, Nicaragua, with her specialty being cleaning and ironing clothes. She does all this work to improve the quality of life for her children by means of rebuilding their home, which had been in a state of disrepair.

She currently needs to purchase building materials, and for this she turns to Kiva partner Ceprodel, who gave her a loan once for before for her to buy supplies to put up a wall in her home. Now she's requesting a loan to continue the construction and provide a quality roof over the heads of the children she loves.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Con mucho esfuerzo la señora Leila se dedica al trabajo de empleada domestica en el municipio de El Sauce en León sobresaliendo la actividad de lavado y planchado de ropa haciendo todo este trabajo para mejorar la condición de vida de sus hijos por medio de la reconstrucción de su casa de habitación que por mucho tiempo ha estado en mal estado por ser una infraestructura muy deteriorada.

Actualmente necesita invertir en la compra de los materiales de construcción y para esto acude a Ceprodel quien en su primera vez le otorgó créditos para la compra de parte de los materiales para levantar un muro en su casa. Hoy en día solicita el crédito para continuar con la construcción y de esta manera poder brindarle un techo digno a sus hijos que tanto ama.

loans.use: Purchase building materials and pay for labor

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phạm Thị Nồng, 45 years old, joins the TYM Fund in early 2007. She lives with her husband and two school age children. The family weave straw mattresses for living. Their oldest son who labors over sea also sends money home to help his parents. At first, she was afraid to borrow thinking unable to repay, but finally she took out a 200USD loan to buy straw, raw material of straw mattress. Their mattresses are always popular and oversold. The average monthly income is 130-150USD. This second loan she is applying is 325USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Phạm Thị Nồng, 45 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ đầu năm 2007. Chị sống với chồng và hai con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Thu nhập chủ yếu của gia đình chị là dệt chiếu. Người con lớn đi lao động ở nước ngoài cũng thường gửi tiền về phụ giúp bố mẹ. Thời gian Quỹ mới về hoạt động chị Nồng không dám tham gia vì sợ không trả được. Thấy chị em trong thôn vay trả thuận lợi, chị bàn với chồng vay 200USD về mua thêm cói dệt chiếu tăng thu nhập đồng thời tạo việc lúc rãnh rỗi. Kinh nghiệm dệt chiếu của gia đình chị có thâm niên nên chỉ sau vài tháng sử dụng vốn vay chị cảm thấy yên tâm với việc trả tuần. Chiếu dệt ra của chị được rất nhiều người ưa thích, thu nhập bình quân đạt 130-150USD/tháng. Vòng vốn thứ hai này chị tiếp tục xin vay 325USD về mua cói.

loans.use: Buy straw, raw material to make straw mattresses

loans.name: Pona

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Pona M.. She is married and has three children, ages 4, 9, and 13. She also has a dependent, her niece, who lives with her.

In 2002, Pona established her crop and textiles business. Pona has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice and traditional cloth. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, the women lack tangible collateral assets, and financial institutions do not consider them to be credit-worthy. This leads to poor financial support and, as a result, limited access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys the equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, and traditional african cloth.

loans.name: Sit

texts.en: Sit S. L. is 28 years of age, living as a housewife in Kampong Cham province. He husband, Bun Thol, is also 28 years old and is a head construction worker ranked directly beneath the group’s foreman. He aspires to be foreman himself someday and earn a better salary. Right now he earns $7 (US) per day which is a fair wage in his line of work. They only have one child right now to support. This small business loan will mostly go towards purchasing her husband construction tools to enable him to perform better as a construction worker and hopefully someday lead to his advancement.

loans.use: To buy construction tools.

loans.name: Aïcha

texts.fr:
Born in 1977 in Bafilo, Mrs. Aïcha A. is married to Mr. Laminou Seydou who is a driver. She has one child, and she sells African print cloth as an ambulant retailer, going through the streets in the Agoè neighborhood. She began this business during 2007.

Having a problem due to insufficient stock, she is requesting a first loan to buy 27 lengths of African print cloth of middle quality and 9 lengths of average quality so that she can attract more customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née en 1977 à Bafilo, Madame A. Aïcha s’est mariée à monsieur SEYDOU Laminou qui est chauffeur. Elle a un enfant et est revendeuse ambulant de pagne dans le quartier d’Agoè. Elle a commencé cette activité au cours de l’année 2007.

Mais étant confronté au problème d’insuffisance de stock, elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 27 pièces de pagnes de qualité intermédiaire et 9 pièces de qualité moyenne afin de pouvoir attirer plus de clients.

loans.use:
Purchase of 36 lengths of African print cloth

Achat 36 pièces de pagnes

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a fifty-five year old married mother with four children. Rita has a grain mill in her house, and with the help of several employees, she provides milling services. Rita buys cereal and processes it to later sell in different markets in the city of Ayacucho. Additionally, Rita makes dried potatoes and washes quinoa and sells them to middlemen that take them to coastal cities.

Rita is a member of the Despertar Village Bank in Ayacucho, Perú.

Rita needs a loan of 2000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles ($750 US Dollars) to buy more potatoes and barley.

Rita´s dream is to develop her business, have more capital, and improve her house and her children´s studies.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes and barley.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
K. Saodat is 43 years old. She’s married and the loving mother of five children. Saodat is a farmer. She is a strong woman physically and spiritually. Each day she works diligently to make sure she takes good care of her crop. She has worked in agriculture for five years, and in that time has gained much experience and a love for the land.

Together with her husband, Saodat is growing crops like potatoes, onions, tomatoes, cucumbers, and carrots. They work from early morning until late evening. Each year they grow sufficient crops for the family to eat and to sell.

With her job, Saodat has been able to pay for the schooling of her 5 children. This motivates her even more to keep working the land. Saodat wants to cover the higher education expenses of her elder son as he has entered the university. With this purpose she’s asking for a loan 2000 Somoni (600 US dollars). She would like to use this loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for the harvest and for improving production, and thus increase the quality and value of the yield and increase sales. She is planning to repay the loan in 8 months. Your support will really help her. Be an important part of the growth of Saodat’s business. With your help, this will be possible.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Abdumajid

texts.en: R. Abdumajid is 54 years old. He is married and he has three children. The two eldest are sons and the youngest is a daughter. His eldest son is married and has his own family. Abdumajid is an economist. With the purpose of improving his living conditions, he decided to start his own business. He learned two years ago about processing the apricot’s clingstone and runs his own business at home with the help of his friendly family. The business is very successfull and now Abdumajid needs a loan in order to meet customer demand. He is requesting a loan of $300 for the term of 9 months for purchasing more apricots. Abdumajid and his family sincerely thank you for your support.

loans.use: Purchasing apricots

loans.name: Mariama Néné

texts.fr: Mariama Néné Dramé, 44 ans, mariée, 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Centre depuis 5 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des légumes, des arachides, haricots, oignons, pommes de terre et des denrées alimentaires diverses sur une étale au marché de Grand Dakar. Ses revenus lui permettent d’assurer une partie des charges familiales. <b>Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Mariama Néné Dramé, age 44, is married and has six children in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of Boucotte Centre for five and a half years. Her work consists of buying and selling vegetables, peanuts, beans, onions, potatoes, and various grocery items. She displays her merchandise at the Grand Dakar marketplace. Her income enables her to ensure that a portion of the family expenses is covered. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell vegetables and various groceries

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Asha Kasanqu from Mwanza, a beautiful city on the shores of Lake Victoria. (Lake Victoria is famous not only because it is one of the largest lakes in the world, but also because it feeds the Nile River, a very important source of life for Africa.) Asha is married and has 4 children between the ages of 2 and 17. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one other dependent.

For the past 2 years Asha has been running a mama lishe. A mama lishe is a restaurant or café in Tanzania that usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long wooden benches. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough made from maize flour), and plantains (cooked savory bananas), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces. I was happy to discover she also serves up my favorite Tanzanian delight, vitumbuwa. Vitumbuwa is made out of rice, sugar, water, and eggs (optional), and is deep-fried to create a slightly sweet, puffy yet dense pancake of sorts. It is a "must try" if you ever find yourself in Tanzania!

Asha works at her business 6 days a week. She currently earns about $75 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase ingredients for her menu items at her mama lishe, including rice, sugar, and cooking oil. Asha thanks you for supporting her business!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients (such as rice, sugar, and cooking oil) for her restaurant

loans.name: Khalida M.maqbool Group

texts.en:
Khalida baji is a 20 year old married woman and resides in Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 10 years. Her husband, M., is a wood seller by profession. He has been selling wood for the past 10 years. Khalida baji has one daughter who reads in 3rd standard. Khalida baji completed her education until the 10th standard and she now runs an education center in her house where she teaches the children of her community. She earns Pak rupees 3,000 per month and shares her income with her husband so that they are able to meet the expenses of her house and the education needs of her daughter. She has successfully repaid her four loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and is now applying for a loan to buy more woods to expand her husband’s wood selling business.

Khalida baji is a group leader of a few more members in her locality. Saima baji is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. Nawab baji is requesting a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Kaneez Fatima baji is requesting a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each others loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment of the entire loan.

loans.use: To buy wood for resale.

loans.name: Nhean

texts.en: Nhean S. is 22 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province. She earns a living by raising pigs in a stall next to her house. She will raise two lots of pigs per year and sells them to the slaughterer every six months. She has been earning an income of approximately $4 a day, since 2006. She is married with one son who is a minor and still under her care. Her husband is a farmer and also a wood cutter. To expand the business and earn more revenue, S. is applying for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and a buffalo to use in her husband business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Sanata

texts.fr:
Madame   Sanata T.  a 25 ans, elle réside avec son époux et leurs trois (3) enfants (1garçon et 2 filles) à Wayerma II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame  Sanata T. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, elle s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et de vente des  friperies et des vêtements.
Elle mène son activité au grand marche de Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de quinze (15) ans. Après 3 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel, tous correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 2 balles de friperie de qualités différentes 
(T-Shirt, chemises, napérons, serviettes, etc.). Elle achète ses marchandises sur place avec les grossistes avant de les revendre en détail.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Sanata T., age 25, resides with her husband and children (one boy and two girls) Wayerma II, one of the working-class districts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having done many kinds of work unsuccessfully, she got started buying and selling used clothing and such. She works at the grand marketplace of Sikasso, where she is in great demand because of the quality of her products.

To satisfy her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso over fifteen year ago. After three solidarity loans (group loans) in a women’s association in her district, she is on her second individual loan. All preceding loans have been correctly repaid. She plans to use this loan to buy 2 bales of used goods (T-shirts, blouses, place mats, napkins, etc.) of different grades. She buys locally from wholesalers and then makes her sales at the retail level.

With this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase her working capital, to help with family expenses, to pay the loan interest, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing and such

loans.name: Hoja

texts.ru: Одилов Ходжа житель города Яван. Живет он в одном из отдаленных кишлаков города. Зарабатывает на жизнь путем разведения крупно рогатого скота. Занимается этим делом уже шесть лет. Ему 46 лет , он женат и имеет шестерых детей. Обратился за кредитом для того, чтобы купить дойную корову. Получаемое молоко сможет продавать и таким образом получать дополнительный доход. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hoja O. lives in one of the most remote villages of Yavan. He makes a living by raising livestock. He has been in this business for 6 years. Hoja is 46 years olf and is married with six children. He would like to get a loan so that he could purchase a dairy cow and make extra cash by selling milk. Hoja would be able to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu H. is 70 years old. She is married and the mother of six children. All of her children are independent, and she is now living with four of her grandchildren. She has been trading on top of a table for twenty years now.

She prepares and sells corn dough, cassava dough, and other food ingredients in the community market where she lives. She also sells dried fish and smoked fish in addition to her other products. She purchases most of her goods from the main market of Kumasi and retails them to the community. She has been struggling to buy more from the market.

She requests a loan to buy foodstuffs like maize, cassava for the preparation of dough, and other food ingredients like tomatoes and spices. She hopes to receive GH¢500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. Mariama belongs to a village bank called ‘Bamali Allah’ which means ‘It is only God who can do it’.

loans.use: To buy cassava, maize, spices and smoked fishes

loans.name: Nak Bakht Group

texts.en:
Nak Bakht is the group leader of Nak bakht group. There are four members in this group. They want to expand their businesses and make them larger. Nak Bakta wants to take a loan for her bakery business because she needs more flour for her bakery. Hzraw wants a loan for the business of tailoring. Salma wants a loan for her husband, who does carpentry. Roya wants to take a loan for tailoring because she needs more materials for her business.

They have requested a group loan of 58800 Afghani for a term of 10 months They would like to say that the loan process is the best because it can support those who really need money.

loans.use: To expand her bakery

loans.name: Ketifalawo D Nakimuli Rose Group

texts.en: Mrs. Rose N. is a married woman, age 40, with five kids and four other dependents. Mrs. Rose N. owns a retail shop selling sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, rice, cooking oil, tea leaves, soap and cosmetics. She has been in this business for two years. She is using this loan to purchase more stock as she wants to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia A. is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has three children, two sons and a daughter. According to her, all her children are currently in primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

Cecilia works to support her husband financially to provide for the family. Her husband is a commercial driver while she is a trader. Cecilia trades in cereals such as maize, beans, etc. She procures the goods all the way from Ejura in the northern sector and sells at the local market to food vendors and retailers. She has been in business for over eight years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hoping to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
"I am a farmer and still single. Marriage is something that I need to prepare for. My only hope is that I will have an abundant harvest always to save money for my future family," says Mr. Renato A., from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur.

He would like a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, insecticides and certified seeds. The loan will be helpful to improve the soil condition of the farm as well as to ensure a good harvest.

CEVI provides their clients with not just loans. They also give training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, herbicides, insecticides and certified seeds

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en: Education is the most important inheritance Kamala M.  and her husband can give to their two dear daughters. They are both very responsible parents, and they work very hard in agriculture and farming so that they can give their children the opportunity to finish school – an opportunity they never had due to poor finances. This happy mother has been working in agriculture since getting married and, with the unconditional support of her husband she buys and sells cattle in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. Even so, she now finds herself with more expenses, and she would like a loan of 1200USD in order to increase their capital by increasing their number of cattle.

loans.use: To purchase three baby calves

loans.name: Maylynn

texts.en: Maylynn F., 23, is married with two children. She has three years of experience in the furniture-making business. She sells to the general public six days per week. This is her first loan with SPBD, a Kiva partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala. SPBD loans are Maylynn’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase plywood, varnish, paint and nails

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is 44 years old. She is a widow and mother of five children. Three of the children attend school and the elder children are farmers. As a single mother, she works very hard to finance her childrens education . For the past nine years, Abena has prepared and baked bread. In spite of the challenges she faces, her bread business brings hope to her family. 

She has customers who come to her to buy bread in bulk, and sometimes she sells through hawking. Her only problem now is finding adequate funds to buy raw materials to meet her customers demands. She is requesting a loan to support her business needs and improving her ability to save for her children education.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood etc.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en:
Marcelino T., 44, lives in a fairly large village in San Mateo, Rizal.  His wife, Flordeliza, 45, is a freelance writer.  They have five adult children, three of whom are enrolled in college and the other two who are in high school.

Marcelino has a college degree in Journalism and has worked as writer/editor for different local publications for 12 years.  He ventured into videography when the publications business in the country experienced great losses. He trained with a local media outfit and his career in media services started. In 2003, Marcelino began to provide photo/video coverage for his clients and continues to do so now. He has a small studio where he produces and edits raw video footage. Marcelino is earning close to P50,000 a month out of this business. Three members of his family work in the studio.

Marcelino joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in the summer of 2008.  He applied for a P13,000 loan from CCT.  He would like to purchase sophisticated gadgets used in video production and post production to enhance the quality of his pictures and videos.      

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To purchase items used in photo/video editing

loans.name: Mwembe Songo Group

texts.en:
Zuhuda is a member of the Mwembe songo borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 28 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 13,8, and 1 years.

Zuhuda started her own cafe business selling food 3 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 210,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Zuhuda first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 350,000 Tsh in order to buy more rice,wheat.

With the additional profit she gains from the us of this loan,Zuhuda hopes to save money,pay school fees,get more food for family and expand her business.

Hadija is another member of the same borrower group,she also requested the loan amount 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice,wheat

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is fifty – two years old. She is widowed and has given birth to five children, two sons and three daughters who are all in school. She is a hardworking woman. Victoria lives with her children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is a trader. She trades in fuel – charcoal and firewood. She supplies to food vendors and restaurant operators in her community. Victoria buys her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy bags of charcoal and firewood in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Ban

texts.en: Ban Moun, 57, is married with two children living at home in Siem Reap province. She works in a grocery store, typically making US$ 5 each day. Her husband is a communal chief. Her husband, Heng Phon, typically makes about US$ 2 each day. Ban Moun would like a loan of US$ 500 to diversify her grocery products.

loans.use: To diversify her grocery products.

loans.name: Pok

texts.en:
Pok S., 30, sells yams and corn with her husband in the local market of the province of Takeo. They typically make about $6 each day. This couple has four young children: three of them are in school.

Pok S. is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase a motorcycle. She needs this to transport yams and corn to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to transport her goods to market

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida P. is from the village of Dawo. She is 51 years old, married and has five children. Four of her children are adult-aged and the youngest is at school. To make a living, Zenaida owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Zenaida has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Zenaida joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her third from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma A. and her husband, Avelino, have three children ranging in age from 18 to 23 years old. Her eldest works abroad as a domestic helper and her second child is an unemployed high school graduate. In spite of the monthly remittance Vilma receives from her daughter abroad, she feels unhappy knowing that her child is working for other people the hard way. Instead of making herself feel guilty about her children's lives, she is inspired to work harder in her business to make it grow and become more stable. Once this happens, she will be asking her children to work with her and no longer enslave themselves abroad.

Vilma wants to grow her hog-raising business with the loan she's requested through ASHI. Her husband is a farm laborer and brings in income sporadically; therefore, she has to do her part to generate income for the family. She especially wants to support her youngest child in college (who will be graduating in the next two years).

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed required for fattening

loans.name: Bernabe

texts.en: Bernabe is a rice farmer and his wife, Evelinda, raises hogs. They have three children: Joie -15 years old, 1st year high school; Jojo -14 years old, grade III; and Angel - six years old. Bernabe would like a loan of 7,000 PHP that he will use to purchase farm supplies. The couple want their children tp finish a higher level of education because this is the only thing they could give to them. So they work hard to continually support the schooling of their children. Bernabe would be glad if his loan request is granted.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia se dedica a la venta de peluches, los vende ambulando y otras veces en las ferias; es la única fuente de trabajo que ella tiene.

Vive en alquiler; la casa queda ubicada en la  Villa Tunari, Provincia murillo de la ciudad de La Paz. 

Su esposo trabaja como chofer asalariado.

 Tiene dos  hijos  los cuales estudian en la escuela de la misma zona.

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de mercadería (más peluches) ya que por estas fechas de navidad se incrementara las ventas.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Antonia sells stuffed animals. She sells them in various markets and sometimes at fairs. It is the only source of work she has. She rents a home, which is located in Villa Tunari in the Murillo province of the city of La Paz. Her husband works as a salaried driver. She has two sons who are studying at school in the same area. The loan will be used to purchase merchandise (more stuffed animals) because with the upcoming Christmas days, sales will increase. This is her second loan with Impro; an evaluation of her history cleared her for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more stuffed animals (in high demand during Christmas holidays)

loans.name: Rébecca

texts.fr: B. Rébecca est née en 1960 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Rébecca vit depuis 27 ans à PK10 Enafa, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Mariée à YEHOUENOU Benjamin, un chauffeur, Rébecca est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Rébecca vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Rébecca n’a pas été à l’école. Pour venir en aide à son mari, Rébecca vend de l’akassa (aliment local fait à base d’amidon de maïs) à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Rébecca s’approvisionne. Rébecca a déjà 20 ans d’expérience dans cette activité. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de cinq crédits dans l’institution. Rébecca a bien remboursé les cinq crédits qu’elle avait obtenus de ALIDé. Vu la forte demande des clients en son produit, Rébecca voudrait agrandir le volume de son activité pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. C’est la raison pour laquelle Rébecca sollicite un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Rébecca B. was born in 1960 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Rébecca has lived in PK10 Enafa, in the village of Sèmè-Podji, for 27 years. Married to Benjamin Yehouenou, a driver, Rébecca has three children, all of whom are in school. Rébecca lives with her husband and children. Together, the couple supports the family.

Rébecca did not go to school. To help her husband, she sells "akassa," a local dish made from a starch and maize base, from her home. In Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, Rébecca stocks up on supplies. She has 20 years of experience with this work.

Rébecca is an old client of ALIDé, having already received five loans from them. She repaid all of the previous loans in full. Due to growing demand and the popularity of her product, Rébecca would like to grow her business to better satisfy her customers. For this reason, she is asking for a sixth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 10 sacks of maize

loans.name: Matuu

texts.en:
Matuu I. is 45 and married with 5 children (ages 6 - 18).  She owns a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish .  Matuu has many years of experience in this business.  Matuu needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase a fishing boat.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 250 tala or US $104 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2008, Matuu joined SPBD.    This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Matuu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Matuu I. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.99 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en: Marcelino E.'s main source of income comes from his sari-sari store (general store) selling daily use products such as shampoo, sugar, soy sauce, vinegar, and coffee in his community. He is 64 years old, married and has four adult children. He is from the village of Danlugan, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. Marcelino has been in his business for over five years and earns approximately 1,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Marcelino joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Marcelino is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be his first loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue to provide for the basic needs of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tamemsu Traders Group

texts.en:
These are the members of the Tamemsu Traders Group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in the city of Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of 4,000,000 SLL (1,000,000 SLL each) to enable them to further strengthen their businesses. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in size and quality. Consequently, they will make more sales and a better profit. As their profit-to-sales margin increases, they will be able to better support themselves and their children.

The leader of this group is Samuel I. K.. Samuel was born in the city of Makeni. He is age 45. He is married and has three children. Samuel's children are attending secondary school. He sells both soft and hard drinks. He has been in this business for many years now. He will use this loan to buy more drinks to add to his current stock.

(Attached on the left of the photo is a group member who was not present for the group photo.)

loans.use: To buy crates of soft and hard drinks

loans.name: Encarnacion Delfina

texts.es: Encarnacion tiene 59 años, es divorciada y tiene una hija. Ella estudio la primaria. Es conocida como una persona trabajadora y se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo y chicharron en el Mercado de Totonicapan, tiene diez años de experiencia en el negocio. Acudio a ASDIR para solicitar su primer credito para poder comprar unos marranos y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Encarnación is 59, divorced, and has a daughter. She has an elementary school education. She is known as a hard-working person. She sells pork and “chicharron” (made from 3 or 4 chunks of pork, served with fried potatoes, sweet or savory corn, onion, and spearmint salad) in the Totonicapan Market. She has ten years of experience in the business. She comes to ASDIR to ask for her first loan to be able to buy some pigs to get better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Meriecris

texts.en: Meriecris T. is from the village of Bunawan, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Meriecris is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Meriecris operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling electronic load (mobile phone prepaid credits or airtime) for Smart and Globe (Philippine mobile-phone companies) in the local community. Meriecris has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2008, Meriecris joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Meriecris has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Meriecris is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Meriecris from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Huderbat

texts.en:
Huderbat is 34 years-old and lives with his wife and children in Zavhan province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent called a ger. 

Currently, Huderbat operates a carpentry business in his province. He mainly produces wooden items such as doors, frames, tables and chairs used in ger construction and as traditional ger furniture. Huderbat is very well equipped and operates his business in a workplace which belongs to his uncle who partners with him. He has been operating his business since 2004 and has gained much experience. Huderbat is a very hardworking person who has good communication skills. He says, “I like my work very much. I use to play with wooden toys when I was little child.”  He is requesting a 300,000 tugrugs (~ 225 USD) loan to purchase more timber for his business.

loans.use: To purchase timber.

loans.name: Ablan Novignon

texts.fr: Cette femme a commencé en 2003 le commerce de charbons de bois, actuellement son stock est en baisse raison pour laquelle elle sollicite son tout premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter  6 sacs de charbons de bois pour gonfler son stock. Elle est divorcée de son époux et a à sa charge un enfant. Les revenus issus de son commerce lui permettent de subvenir aux charges du foyer.
texts.en:
This lady began to sell charcoal in 2003, and presently her stocks are depleted, which is the reason why she is requesting her first ever loan from WAGES to buy 6 sacks of charcoal to bolster her inventory. She is divorced from her husband and is raising a child.The income from her little business allows her to support her household.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira tiene 33 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Juan de 43 años, quien es agricultor y de sus 3 hijos, que aún estudian en el colegio. Bajo el cielo azul de la sierra, esta trabajadora mujer se despierta cada mañana para vigilar sus cultivos, que en compañía de su esposo, siembran papas, alverjas, lechugas y flores de gladiolos. Sabe que el trabajo agrícola requiere de mucha dedicación, si desean obtener una buena cosecha. Una ve que la producción esta lista para la venta, es transportada al mercado mayorista de la ciudad, en donde los comerciantes le ofrecen buenos precios, esto le permite recibir regulares ganancias. Por esta razón, es que le gusta mucho trabajar en el campo, ya que sabe que todo sacrificio tiene su recompensa y  más aún cuando puede brindarles una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos. Elvira sueña que sus hijos lleguen a estudiar una profesión  en la ciudad y no descansara hasta cumplirlo; y como es una mujer muy emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, además quiere instalar un negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, además esta muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su grupo porque esta integrado por damas muy responsables en el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Elvira tiene planeado invertir el crédito en la compra de semilla de alverjas y fertilizantes para asegurar sus tierras en la siguiente siembra y lograr una cosecha productiva.
texts.en:
Elvira is 33 years old and lives in her own home alongside her husband, Juan, who is a 43 year old farmer. They have three children who are still in school. Beneath the blue sky of the sierra, this hard working women wakes up every morning to tend to her crops. With the help of her husband, she plants potatoes, peas, lettuce, and gladioli flowers. She knows that agricultural work requires a lot of dedication in order to obtain a good harvest. Once the produce is ready for selling, it is transported to the city’s major market where the tradesmen offer them a good price. This allows them to receive a regular income. For this reason, she loves working in the countryside. She knows that all her sacrifice has its rewards and allows her to create a good quality of life for her children. Elvira’s dream is that her children will study a profession in the city and she won’t rest until this happens. As she is an enterprising woman, she is planning to plant more crops in the future. In addition, she would like to install a business selling basic necessities. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very satisfied with the work of her group because it is made up of women who are very responsible and make their repayments on time. Elvira plans to use the credit to buy pea seeds and fertilizers in order to enrich her soils for future crops and have a productive harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es: La señora Rosa María es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, desde hace un año pensó en invertir en un negocio, en el que ahora ella trabaja; esta es una dulcería la cual es llamada “Santa Rosa” donde vende mucha variedad de dulces, chocolates, botanas y también abarrotes. A Rosa le gusta tener artículos diferentes en todos los aspectos marca y sabores; es por ello que en este momento requiere de un préstamo para invertir mas en el negocio para ofrecer al cliente calidad.
texts.en:
Rosa María is a hard working, enterprising woman. Last year she thought about investing in the business that she now runs; a candy store called, “Santa Rosa,” where she sells a variety of candy, chocolates, snacks, and groceries. She likes to stock a variety of brands and flavors. She needs this loan in order to buy more items for the business and continue to offer good quality to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: Adama R., a businesswoman who sells building materials with her husband along Prince Williams Street Bo,  is married with three children, all attending primary school. They work collectively to take care of the home.  Adama is requesting a loan to buy more stock to satisfy customer demand, and intends to use the additional proceeds accruing from the loan to start their house construction.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for the business

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He is 42 years old and married with 8 children between the ages of 2½ and 21. Five of the children are currently attending school.

He has been farming for 21 years and has employed 2 people from the community. His main product is milk, which he sells on the local market and the tea estate. He also earns income from his tea which he sells on the local market. His biggest challenge has been lack of qualified artificial insemination services, lack of animal feed, and lack of knowledge of animal diseases.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 45,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will increase the family's income through the sale of milk and enable him to repay the loan and meet the family's needs.

In future, he would like to improve his dairy farming by increasing the number of high yielding dairy cows and buying land to plant grass for the dairy cows.

Reuben is grateful to Juhudi for the services provided.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel, de 23 años, es una joven muy alegre y sencilla, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposo Jaime de 26 años y su único hijo Yosmel de 3 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La actividad a la que se dedica Maribel, es el cultivo de papa y alverja, sobre tierras que compró, es así que trabaja con mucha dedicación y esfuerzo en su actividad, luego de un tiempo al cosecharlas son comercializadas en el mercado mayorista de Tarma. Disfruta mucho el trabajo que realiza, y de esa manera han transcurrido 3 años, trabajando y tomando sus propias decisiones. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que ser puntual en sus pagos, como la ha sido en sus anteriores créditos. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy solidaria y esta muy comprometida con el desarrollo de sus grupos. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
23-year old Maribel is a cheerful straightforward young woman. She and her husband, 26-year old Jaime and their only child 3-year old Yosmel, live with her parents. Her husband and son are what motivates Maribel to work hard. She grows potatoes and peas on a plot of land that she owns. She puts in a lot of effort and hard work. After harvesting the vegetables, she sells them at the wholesale market in Tarma. Maribel enjoys her work. She’s been doing this job and making her own decisions for three years. In the future she hopes to buy more land and increase production. This is Maribel’s first loan with Kiva partner MFP. She knows she has to be punctual with her repayments as she has been with other loans in the past. In her community group she is considered a dedicated member, committed to the development of the group. With the loan she plans to buy more fertilizer for her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Roberto  Enrique

texts.es:
Roberto Vásquez tiene 56 años y vive en el barrio la Central del Municipio de Soledad, con su cónyuge y sus 5 hijos en las edades de 22 a 35 años; Su negocio es un centro de llamadas o SAI, donde adicionalmente vende productos de dulcería  y galletería y tambien tiene un puesto en el centro de Barranquilla donde comecializa CD y accesorios para celulares. Inició su negocio cuando observó la necesidad del sector, pues él primero vendía lotería y se hizo a una clientela  importante, porque tuvo un equipo de vendedores por más de 30 años. Roberto procede del Carmen de Bolívar donde se desempeñaba como empleado y luego empezó a trabajar por su cuenta. Toda esta habilidad emprendedora surgió porque es el hijo mayor de una familia y la falta de su papá hizo que trabajara  desde muy joven  y se hiciera  responsable para poder ayudar a su mamá. 
Desde el año 2002 creó su propia alternativas de ingresos; posteriormente  inició con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo organización que le ha suministrado 3 créditos que le han permitido multiplicar su capital de trabajo y las utilidades le han servido para sostener los gastos del hogar, comprar muebles, electrodomésticos, mejorar su vivienda la que inicialmente fue un lote que compró, y que poco a poco ha ido construyendo con sus ahorros y con mucho esfuerzo. En la actualidad solicita un credikiva por valor de $1.300.000 para comprar planes de minutos más extensos pues su mercado se ha aumentado y no son suficientes los que tienen, para comprar C.D y MP3 para la venta. 
Su meta es crecer como persona y adicionar a su negocio computadores.Aunque sabe que su principal desafío es el mínimo capital con el cual trabaja, también tiene otros desafíos como el de ayudar a su hija a que termine sus estudios universitarios, pues en el momento está en octavo semestre de Ingeniería de sistemas.
Está muy contento con el entorno que rodea a su negocio porque allí se ha hecho muy conocido y esta rodeado de vecinos tranquilos y de convivencia pacifica.
texts.en:
Roberto Vásquez, 56, lives in Soledad’s La Central neighborhood with his wife and five children who are between 22 and 35 years of age. His business is a telephone call center but he also sells candy and cookies. In addition, he has a stand in downtown Barranquilla where he sells CDs and cell phone accessories. He began his business when he recognized the need that existed in his area. He used to sell lottery tickets and acquired an important customer base that way. He had a sales team for over 30 years. Roberto is from Carmen de Bolívar where he used to be an employee until he started to work for himself. All of this business ability arose because he is the first-born son of a family and the absence of his father required him to start working from a very early age; he needed to be responsible in order to help his mother. Since 2002 he created his own way of earning an income. Later, he started collaborating with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which has granted him 3 loans to date that have made it possible for him to increase his working capital and profits that have helped him meet household expenses, buy furniture, home appliances and make home improvements (which started out as an empty lot he bought and gradually has been using savings and much effort to build his home). He is now asking for a Kiva loan in the amount of #1.300.000 to buy calling plans with more minutes included because his market has grown and the ones he has are insufficient; he also wants to buy CDs and MP3s to sell. His goal is to grow as a person and to add computers to his business. Although he knows that his main challenge is the minimal capital he works with, he also has other challenges like helping his daughter finish her university education; she is currently in the 8th semester of Computer Sciences. He is very happy with the location of his business because he is very well known there and surrounded by calm neighbors who like to get along with each other.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy calling plans with more minutes included because the market has grown and the ones they have are insufficient; to buy CDs and MP3s to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of insecticide, urea, etc. and plowing the land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 41-year old married man with three young children, who are attending school. He is the main income provider for his family. He has twenty years of experience working as a farmer. He has been running his own farm since 1990. He uses plastic tents to grow his products. These tents also allow him to better monitor product quality as well as grow his products for more months during the year. He works independently in his business. And he distributes the vegetables and fruits that he harvests to local markets. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  to purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work and to improve his business.  And he hopes that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%.

loans.use: to purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work and to improve his business

loans.name: Mrs. In Saroeung Village Bank Group

texts.en: Seventeen people, from the Romiet village I. Takeo province, are requesting a village bank loan. They will each use their portion of the loan for various purposes. Mrs. I. S., born I. 1967, was selected by the other members to be the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land for cultivating rice to sell to support her family while her husband, Mr. Chan Phrum, is a construction worker. Although they do work a lot, they can earn only a little income. So, to improve this condition, Mrs. I. S. is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is a seamstress I. a garment factory, while the others are attending school. One of the members I. this village bank loan is blocked I. the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding to start a new business

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es: Cynthia, de 20 años, vive en casa de sus padres a lado de ellos y de sus 4 hermanos; juntos trabajan cada día para salir adelante. A pesar de su edad trabaja a diario con la única consigna de buscar el progreso. Es por esta razón que hace 1 año se asoció en un grupo de damas tejedoras de la zona donde vive; juntas realizan todo tipo de trabajos que comercializan en el interior y exterior del país. Teje diversidad de carteras y bolsos; además de pulseras y collares, y le gusta mucho su labor ya que la desarrolla desde la comodidad de su casa y obtiene regulares ganancias. A la semana produce una cantidad de artículos tejidos y los vende a los mayoristas de la ciudad;  los precios varían de acuerdo al destino de la mercadería. Lo que no le gusta a Cynthia es trabajar para otros, cuando sabe que si vendiera ella misma obtendría mejores ganancias. Como es una joven emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una librería bazar en algún mercado de su zona, pues anhela ser dueña de un negocio propio.  Es el primer crédito con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Cynthia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de material en hilos de diversos colores, entre otros que necesita para producir sus tejidos en mayor cantidad, de esta manera espera seguir adelante.
texts.en: Cynthia is 20 and lives with her paretns and her 4 siblings; together they work every day to get ahead.  In spite of her young age she works daily with the only goal to find progress.  That's why a year ago she joined a group knitting ladies of the area where she lives, together they make all kinds of products that they sell in and outside the country.  She knits different types of purses and handbags, also bracelets and necklaces and likes her work because she can do it from the comfort of her home and obtain income.  Every week she makes a number of knitted products and sells them to the wholesalers of the city.  Prices vary according to the destination of the merchandise.  What Cynthia doesn't like is having to work for other people knowing that if she made the final sale herself she would obtain higher income.   She is a young entrepreneur and has planned for the future to open a bookstore and bazaar in a marketplace of the zone because she wishes to have her own business.  This is the first loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments punctually because she doesn't want to let down the people that made possible the money that will allow her to continue working in the search for progress.  Cynthia plans to invest the loan in buying yarn of different colors to knit more products and continue to get ahead.

loans.use: Buy various colors of yarn to continue making handbags.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer B. is from the village of Francfort, Bumbaran, Lanao del Sur. She is 25 years old. Jennifer is single. To make a living, Jennifer runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and junk food in the local community. Jennifer has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Jennifer joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and as working capital. This will be the first loan taken out by Jennifer from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell and for working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more used shoes to resell

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy C. is from the village of Tumbao, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 39 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children.
